column2: Description
column3: Description{Enhanced}
column4: Tooltip
column6: SpecialAction{Description}

column2: str
column3: str
column4: str
column6: str

column2: Summon your cherry bomb minion─a miniature recreation of a voidsent bomb, created via the thaumaturgical rendering of umbrally charged aetherial energy. Guaranteed never to self-destruct, or your gil back.
column3: To maintain the white-hot temperatures within their cores, bombs will feed upon almost any combustible material, including wood, charcoal, ceruleum, fire crystals, and even dragon peppers.
column4:
Brilliant bombs─
breathtaking,
beautiful, brilliant!
  - Acolyte Ba Go
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 300 to all enemies within range. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.

column2: Summon your mammet #001 minion─a fully operational clockwork puppet built in a joint effort by the Alchemists' and Goldsmiths' Guilds.
column3: The standard frill-free #001 model is not only the best-selling mammet on the market, but is the blueprint on which all other clockwork servitors are based.
column4:
Mammets can't
even taste food!
  - Serendipity
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your wayward hatchling minion. Until he finds his real mother, you'll have to suffice.
column3: Even if this orphaned avian were to stumble across his birth parent, chances are he would not even blink an eye, for it is well documented that immediately after hatching, chocobos recognize the first thing they see as their mother─that being you.
column4:
Whoa, whoa, whoa!
Hooold your chocobos.
  - Buscarron
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your Cait Sith minion. The ever-extended tail helps the kitten keep his balance.
column3: The clockwork rendition of an enigmatic cat spirit from the pages of Midlander mythology, Goldsmiths' Guild guildmaster Serendipity crafted this lifelike figurine to bring joy to those children who were orphaned in the Calamity.
column4:
What may be a few to
you was everything to
those who died...
  - Cait Sith
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your baby behemoth minion. We can only hope his mother doesn't come looking for him.
column3: Obtainable in Ul'dah's Sapphire Avenue Exchange for a fistful of coin and a smile, the pedigree of this baby beast is questionable at best. While displaying many behemoth-like features─a sleek violet hide, hungry eyes, and two polished horns─its squealing is not unlike a boar at slaughter.
column4:
Disaster follows the man
like a behemoth chasing
a butterfly.
  - Chechezan
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your mammet #003L minion─a fully operational clockwork puppet built for the Maelstrom.
column3: Designed to be a standard-bearer in Maelstrom company parades, these handcrafted automata were soon decommissioned due to the fact that their small stature ensured that no one could see the flags they carried.
column4:
Feelings! Maybe she just
doesn't feel like part of
the team!?
  - Wedge
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your mammet #003G minion─a fully operational clockwork puppet built for the Order of the Twin Adder.
column3: Designed to be a standard-bearer in Order of the Twin Adder company parades, these handcrafted automata were soon decommissioned due to the fact that their small stature ensured that no one could see the flags they carried.
column4:
Feelings! Maybe she just
doesn't feel like part of
the team!?
  - Wedge
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your mammet #003U minion─a fully operational clockwork puppet built for the Immortal Flames.
column3: Designed to be a standard-bearer in Immortal Flames company parades, these handcrafted automata were soon decommissioned due to the fact that their small stature ensured that no one could see the flags they carried.
column4:
Feelings! Maybe she just
doesn't feel like part of
the team!?
  - Wedge
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your storm hatchling minion. Not more than a fortnight out of the shell, but his blood already runs Maelstrom red. Till sea swallows all!
column3: Raised by a storm private from an egg found abandoned in the company stables he was charged with cleaning, this adorable fledgling is a symbol of new beginnings for the mighty Maelstrom.
column4:
Chocobo dander can
be a mite ripe.
  - Chocobokeep
column6:
Binds all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your serpent hatchling minion. Not more than a fortnight out of the shell, but his blood already runs Twin Adder yellow.
column3: Raised by a serpent private from an egg found abandoned in the company stables he was charged with cleaning, this adorable fledgling is a symbol of new beginnings for the Order of the Twin Adder.
column4:
Chocobo dander can
be a mite ripe.
  - Chocobokeep
column6: Removes all effects from all enemies and allies within range.

column2: Summon your flame hatchling minion. Not more than a fortnight out of the shell, but his blood already runs Immortal Flames black.
column3: Raised by a flame private from an egg found abandoned in the company stables he was charged with cleaning, this adorable fledgling is a symbol of new beginnings for the Immortal Flames.
column4:
Chocobo dander can
be a mite ripe.
  - Chocobokeep
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your morbol seedling minion...if you think you can stand his breath.
column3: It is in fashion amongst wealthy Ul'dahn merchants and nobles to bring morbol seedlings to banquets, so that the upper crust might inhale the seedkin's “boot-like” bad breath to induce vomiting, allowing them to engorge themselves for the duration of the gatherings.
column4:
Did a morbol just empty
its innards? I feel ill...
  - Imperial Soldier
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your tiny rat minion. He may infest your granaries, and he may carry the plague, but he's <Emphasis>simply too adorable</Emphasis> to condemn to the life-ending jaws of a metal trap.
column3: It was only recently that an enterprising merchant from the Sapphire Avenue Exchange in Ul'dah was tossed into the sultanate's oubliettes for fluffing the tails of rats caught on Pearl Lane and selling prettied pests to tourists as “tiny squirrels.”
column4:
Pray waste no time
chasing rats.
  - Nanamo Ul Namo
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 25%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your baby bun minion. Tastes great on salads and in stews.
column3: For those wondering on the ill effects of inhaling spores released by common funguars, according to the <Emphasis>Encyclopedia Eorzea</Emphasis> (third edition), funguar spores “befoul the body's humours and claim control of an individual's very soul, rendering them a mindless thrall.”
column4:
You mushroom-headed,
spindly-legged, spore-
spewing abominations!
  - Gabineaux
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 13%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your chigoe larva minion. This tiny vilekin takes the blood pact with his master <Emphasis>very</Emphasis> seriously.
column3: Chirurgeons of the fallen city of Gelmorra once used chigoes to leech the dark humours of the infirm until it was realized the patients were contracting additional maladies as a result of the treatment.
column4:
What am I going to do
with a pile of dead vilekin?
  - Waltheof
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 60.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your bluebird minion. Known to retroactively bring good fortune to those who have already experienced good fortune.
column3: Fortunate to hatch before being eaten by lizards. Unfortunate to fall from its nest before learning to fly. Fortunate to land in an empty treasure coffer. Unfortunate to still be in said coffer as it is filled with booty and locked up again. Fortunate to be plundered...by you.
column4:
The disbelieving cries
of our foe will be as
the sweetest birdsong.
  - Yadovv Gah
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wide-eyed fawn minion. His mother was either lost in a terrible hunting accident...or perhaps is just lost.
column3: An easy target for Eorzea's carnivorous fauna, antelopes must use every advantage they have to remain free from death's dripping jaws. One of those is the remarkable ability to run mere minutes from birth. Unfortunately, that trait did not save this specimen from capture.
column4:
When making an offering
of antelope innards, it is
proper they are still warm.
  - Common Knowledge
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your infant imp minion. Hopes that one day, he will rule the seven hells. But for now, your backside will do.
column3: Scholars believe there are three ways in which voidsent can make the journey from their realm to ours─tearing a hole in the aether on their side, having a hole torn for them on our side, or stumbling into a randomly occurring hole, the latter being the most common for imps.
column4:
This bastard's got
some nasty spells!
  - Stalwart Swordsman
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your coeurl kitten minion. It will still be several summers before his trademark whiskers grow out.
column3: Coeurls are extremely proud and defiant creatures, even when young. Faced with insurmountable odds, a coeurl will rarely shy away from a fight, choosing rather to perish in combat than run. This characteristic keeps coeurl numbers low, but ensures the strength of those who survive.
column4:
Coeurl got your tongue?
  - Wilred
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your black coeurl minion. Beware, for if one should cross your path, you will experience seven years of...AWWWWWW.
column3: To the untrained eye, this coeurl appears to be of an entirely new species, when in fact the only thing separating him from his mottled brethren is that his spots are so large, they overlap with one another, rendering him completely black.
column4:
Look what the
coeurl dragged in.
  - Momodi
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your wind-up gentleman minion. If “clockwork Hildibrand” doesn't quite roll off the tongue, both “minion of enquiry” and “mammet extraordinaire” are acceptable alternatives.
column3: Though he has once more taken to the heavens in a selfless act of sacrifice, Inspector Hildibrand lives on in the hearts of all whose lives he touched with his inimitable brand of gallantry, perception, and panache. Wind him up and let him follow you as only a Manderville can.
column4:
I have peeled away the
foul scab of uncertainty
to reveal the truth within!
  - Hildibrand
column6:
Increases ATK and DEF of all allies within range by 40. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your gravel golem minion. Only you stand between it and a hard place.
column3: Mage-controlled golems were in such wide use by the end of the Fifth Astral Era that entire battles were waged by armies comprised of nothing but the lifeless soulkin. This recreation, however, is nothing but a standard model #001 mammet outfitted with simple gravel plating.
column4:
Gummice pollums? I fear
I'm not familiar with them.
  - Yhom Epocan
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up tonberry minion. Now with 100% less rancor.
column3: While merely a clockwork toy crafted to resemble the twisted survivors of Nym, owners of similar creations claim waking to find their wind-up tonberries propped upon their chests, wooden knives pressed firmly against their throats.
column4:
I came expectin' to fight
one tonberry, not a whole
bloody mess of 'em.
  - Soft Marauder
column6:
Increases ATK and DEF of all allies within range by 40. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your tiny tortoise minion. Will not carry you to an underwater kingdom if you ride on its back.
column3: Hatched from an egg laid in the ivory sands of La Noscea's Salt Strand, if lucky, this baby adamantoise may live to see as many as ten score summers...that is, if it does not accidentally launch itself off a cliff with its constant spinning.
column4:
What is that foul stench!?
It's like the inside of an
adamantoise's arse!
  -  Wood Wailer Sentry
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 25%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your baby raptor minion. Luckily for you, his teeth haven't all grown in...yet.
column3: Taking a hint from goblin merchants who raise raptors to serve as beasts of burden, a shopkeep from the village of Boughbury has begun hatching raptor eggs of his own (stolen from nearby nests). One can only hope the mother raptors are not as clever as the shopkeep thinks <Emphasis>he</Emphasis> is.
column4:
By the gods...
This raptor is sublime!
  - Nonopesa
column6:
Renders the action party immune to all attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppets<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your baby bat minion. Has yet to acquire a taste for blood.
column3: Nonoroon, resident junkmonger at Memeroon's Trading Post, came up with the idea for capturing and selling baby bats one day while raiding caves for bat eggs...of which he could not find any.
column4:
Even ate a wing off one
afore I made up my mind
to climb down the wall.
  - Ahldfoet
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your tiny bulb minion. Some questions, such as why this bulb can walk, are best left unanswered.
column3: To answer the question, “why can this bulb walk,” one must trace the seedkin's evolution back thousands of generations. Since this guide lacks the space to do so, let us simply say it has something to do with seeking sunlight under the eternal darkness of the Black Shroud's thick canopy.
column4:
Each sapling is another
glimpse into the wonder
of the world around us.
  - Fufucha
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your dust bunny minion. Despite the striking similarities, spriggans are not related to rabbits. But they have been known to eat them.
column3: It is not fully known why spriggans hoard precious rocks and minerals, though scholars would have us believe that it is the rocks and minerals which are hoarding the spriggans, hence the creatures' scientific classification as soulkin.
column4:
Between the four of us,
surely we can outsmart
a few rogue spriggans.
  - Augustiniel
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up dullahan minion. Warning: may contain sharp parts.
column3: Some dullahans are believed to be shapeless entities who must first inhabit an inanimate host (such as a suit of armor) before gaining the ability to exert force upon the corporeal plane. Luckily, the only things inhabiting this wind-up contraption are manifold gears and rods.
column4:
Pray retrieve the gift ere
it is crushed beneath the
iron feet of the dullahans!
  - G'raha Tia
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 180 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your gigantpole minion. Yes, it can survive for hours on end without any water, and yes, it can fly. Your argument is invalid.
column3: Over countless generations, the gigantoads of Thanalan have adapted to the arid climes by taking on traits not seen in their cousins to the north, such as thick membranes to keep their skin hydrated out of water, and a set of extra fins which act as wings to propel them over land.
column4:
These toads are huge,
which means they have
huge guts.
  - Hamon
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your pudgy puk minion. Don't ask what he has eaten to grow so plump.
column3: Fattened from birth to be a succulent snack for the sadistic Steropes, this fledgling puk's excess baggage ensures that even if he attempts to flee, he will not be getting that far.
column4:
Ul'dah ain't more'n a
sand-crusted pile o' puk
dung bakin' in the desert.
  - Baderon Tenfingers
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your buffalo calf minion. Milk-fed until tender and juicy. Not that anyone would <Emphasis>ever</Emphasis> think of eating him.
column3: When the Scions of the Seventh Dawn began clearing out the Waking Sands in preparation for the move to Revenant's Toll, this wide-eyed calf was discovered hiding in a disused linen closet. Though an inquiry was made by the Antecedent herself, it is still not known who was keeping the beast.
column4:
I made the grievous error
of visiting a great buffalo
with a handsaw.
  - Godbert
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your cactuar cutting minion. Take care not to suffer 1,000 points of damage...to your heart.
column3: Hab, loneliest zombie in the realm, is certain that this cactuar cutting was taken from his trusty companion Sabotendrick. Or if not, then most positively Sabotendred. What he does not know, is that it is, in fact, from the oft forgotten Sabotendale.
column4:
The interior of its arm
holds a surprising amount
of fresh, drinkable water.
  - Common Knowledge
column6:
Increases action party movement speed by 30%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your smallshell minion. The mere sight of this wee wavekin may cause severe psychological trauma to those who spent years of their lives on faraway shores culling his relatives.
column3: As is implied by its name, the smallshell's shell is small. What is not widely known is that unlike normal crabs whose shells grow thicker and, hence, larger as the crabs age, smallshell carapaces actually reduce in size due to erosion over the wavekin's lifespan, until nothing is left but legs.
column4:
Got naught but a sea
lion's share of crab offal
'twixt them ears, I reckon.
  - Ighii Moui
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wolf pup minion. Idolizes one Gaius van Baelsar for obvious reasons.
column3: Bred to serve as a war wolf in the Imperial Garlean Army, this pup was rescued before any permanent damage could be done to its playful spirit. He will follow you to the end of the world and back...as long as you toss him an occasional biscuit.
column4:
I've got no words to mince
with whelps...unless you're
here to become a wolf.
  - Curious Gorge
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critter<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your beady eye minion. That feeling you get sometimes that you are being watched? More often than not it is him.
column3: One of the most outlandish theories recently posed by scholars of the void is that ahrimans do not reproduce by typical sexual means, but rather by shedding tears which eventually grow into new creatures.
column4:
Black scorpion to sharpen
one's wit; ahriman
membrane for the mind.
  - Severian
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your fledgling dodo minion. Properly trained not to eructate, regurgitate, expectorate, or flatulate.
column3: Dodos mature extremely fast, going from fledgling to full-grown fryer in but a few short moons. This, coupled with the fact an adult female can lay up to seven eggs a sennight, makes this particular cloudkin the perfect option for feeding the hungry masses.
column4:
Lightning Drools over the
Bismarck's Delightful
Grilled Dodo!
  - The <Emphasis>Harbor Herald</Emphasis>
column6: Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

column2: Summon your coblyn larva minion. Too dangerous to allow to grow any larger...too adorable to condemn to the furnace.
column3: Coblyns will lay their eggs near ore deposits so that when the larvae emerge, they will have a ready supply of nourishment to form their protective outer carapaces. This is a slow process which involves dousing the ore in digestive fluid, waiting for it to clarify, then ingesting the ooze.
column4:
The lads go through gear
faster'n a coblyn chewin'
on a chunk of mythril.
  - Wawarukka
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monster<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up aldgoat minion. No aldgoats were harmed in the making of this automaton.
column3: While in Ishgardian folklore the aldgoat is used to represent greed and gluttony, the Dunesfolk believe the insatiable creatures are a symbol of wealth and prosperity, and will present aldgoat fetishes to families with newborn children.
column4:
A nice big aldgoat steak
should put some color
back in 'er cheeks.
  - Lyngsath
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your fledgling apkallu minion. Will follow you until you give him a fish. Will continue to follow you after being given a fish.
column3: While the hatchlings of other flightless cloudkin have been observed covered in a dull brown coat of down when they emerge from their eggs, apkallus enter the world covered in the same vivid green plumage they will bear for their entire lives.
column4:
Nesting hens do not spear
a failed egg thief a score
and a half times.
  - Frandelont Raimdelle
column6:
Changes action party auto-attacks to area of effect attacks.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 12s

column2: Summon your goobbue sproutling minion. Has been known to attack kittens for no apparent reason.
column3: To achieve their cyclopean size, goobbues must maintain a daily diet of several times their own weight. Luckily, the beastkin are not finicky eaters, and will consume almost anything that cannot outrun them. If rumors are to be believed, this includes Lalafells.
column4:
These goobbues are wont
to devour anything and
everything.
  - Aileen
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your bite-sized pudding minion. Not intended for consumption.
column3: Unable to reproduce, puddings increase their number solely via mitosis. Because of this, it is widely believed that all Eorzea's puddings descended from a single entity─a proto-pudding, if you will. This, however, leaves us with the question: whence did the first pudding come?
column4:
A talking...pudding?
  - You
column6:
Renders the action party immune to all attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppets<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your model vanguard minion. An exact 1:9 scale replica of a ceruleum-powered magitek vanguard (imperial pilot action figure not included).
column3: Part of the Guildmaster Series, this high-quality replica is so exact in its rendition of the vanguard's build that Garlemald has banned the item's import into the Empire's outlying provinces, for fear the data gleaned from it will be used by rebel forces still active in these lands.
column4:
I'd sooner face a vanguard
while naked as my
nameday!
  - Flame Private
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your demon brick minion. We are all better off not knowing what arcane magicks animate this ordinary stone block.
column3: For many years, modern archaeologists did not understand how a seemingly primitive civilization without clockwork or steam technology could build the massive stone structures of Amdapor. Animated bricks, such as the one that has chosen to follow you, may be the missing link.
column4:
Underneath this gear, I'm
built like a brick privy!
  - Chachabi
column6: Knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your mini mole minion. When not dining on a protein-rich diet of earthworms and grubs, he dreams of making mountains.
column3: Snatched from its hill while still young by infamous naturalist Marcette Manne, this poor creature has suffered countless experiments filled with endless pokings, proddings, potations, and panaceas. Compared to that, following an adventurer around all day is a veritable vacation.
column4:
Hear me, you mole
bastards? I am steel!
  - Eager Red Swallow
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your tender lamb minion. Mint jelly optional.
column3: As if predestined, your path crossed with that of the tender lamb's after she was brought to Eorzea from the dark reaches of the Far East by a hitsuji bugyo. Since then, you have been inseparable, the fluffy ball of fleece following your every footstep.
column4:
But everywhere the little
lambs went, lice were sure
to go.
  - Chartain
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your slime puddle minion. Fun for the whole family.
column3: Once stepped upon, slime can be nigh on impossible to remove from the soles of boots, making the shapeless creatures a nuisance to those who mine the mountains in which slimes reside. The <Emphasis>Encyclopedia Eorzea</Emphasis> recommends a squeeze of sun lemon to loosen their stony grip.
column4:
Silence the slimes, lest
you succumb to the
flames.
  - Ancient Proverb
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your kidragora minion. Even in space, everyone can hear this seedkin scream.
column3: One must take care when harvesting mandragoras, for if the roots are disturbed they will emit a high-pitched scream powerful enough to shatter glass over a malm away.
column4:
While little is known about
them, what is known
tends to be disturbing.
  - Eorzean Naturalist
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up goblin minion. Even this automaton's gobbiebag is bigger than yours.
column3: Designed to resemble goblin hero Brayflox Alltalks, you cannot help but wonder at the symbol carved into the sole of its left foot─the mark of the dreaded Illuminati.
column4:
Illuminati brainfruit
is frontmost!
  - Illuminati Member
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your wind-up sylph minion. If he could speak, it would be in the third person.
column3: Unlike most species in which the female bears the offspring, only sylph males are capable of reproduction, and they do so via the single flower found upon their heads. After the flower is fertilized, it will eventually fall off, giving rise to a child known as a podling.
column4:
Helping sylphs with their
problems is a jolly fine
way to make friends.
  - Path Companion
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your wind-up cursor minion. Modeled after the ivory glove of Oschon, the Wanderer, does this clockwork hand follow you...or guide you?
column3: If we are to believe the slurred ravings of a self-proclaimed goblin theologian deep in his cups, this seemingly inconspicuous white glove is actually the “Hand of Fate” by which all of us are controlled from a dimension beyond the aether.
column4:
I trust ye had enough
fingers to help ye through
the tallyin'.
  - Yulgi Honalgi
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your wind-up airship minion. A fully operational model of the legendary vessel, the <Emphasis>Invincible</Emphasis>.
column3: Despite it being the first, and most ambitious undertaking by Highwind Skyways founder Tatanora, the <Emphasis>Invincible</Emphasis> actually never took flight─its ten-year construction period plagued by accidents, material shortages, sabotage, and outright incompetence.
column4:
Up in the sky, look! It's a
bird─ No, it's an airship─
No! It's the inspector!
  - Nashu Mhakaracca
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>gadget<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Qiqirn minion. As adorable as the real thing, without the ratty odor.
column3: Once upon a time, there was not a man, woman, or child in all of Limsa Lominsa who did not know the name Zazaroon, mummer extraordinaire. However, a taste for spiced rum, a failed marriage, and several run-ins with the Barracudas saw the Qiqirn fall from the limelight into oblivion.
column4:
The Qiqirn are a nuisance
at the best of times.
  - Roseline
column6:
Grants action party the ability to deal extra damage to Arcana Stones.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your black chocobo chick minion. Rumors about her being able to fly are completely unfounded...or <Emphasis>are</Emphasis> they?
column3: This poor chocobo chick was as yellow as an ear of millioncorn before one day being doused in black ink by a random passerby bedecked in silver accessories. Try as the chocobokeeps might, none were able to remove the taint, and thus the realm's first black chocobo was born.
column4:
There is no finer feel
than that of a chocobo
between your legs.
  - L'dhakya
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Dalamud minion. Do not attempt to pry open under any circumstances.
column3: After Dalamud's fall, a wealthy Ul'dahn noble commissioned a famous troupe of musicians to write a dirge for the heroes of Carteneau and play it across Eorzea so that the deeds of the fallen would not be forgotten. This wind-up model of the red moon has naught to do with the dirge.
column4:
The lifeblood spilled in
Dalamud's name shall be
blessed upon his return.
  - Foxe
column6:
Increases action party movement speed by 30%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your minute mindflayer minion. Delights folk with its cuteness even as it fills them with an inexplicable sense of dread.
column3: Similar to voidsent dullahans, mindflayers also lack a corporeal form and must possess a host to be able to exert force on our realm. Whereas the dullahan, however, are limited to the possession of inorganic objects such as steel, mindflayers tend to prefer the dead as their vessels.
column4:
It has a grisly penchant
for sucking out the brains
of men.
  - Frandelont Raimdelle
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your tight-beaked parrot minion. For best results, summon while wearing an eyepatch.
column3: After witnessing the horrors experienced by his former master, Captain Madison, this once-outspoken oppo has gone silent, opening its beak only when offered a handful of sardines.
column4:
Parley! Parley!
Parley! Squaaawk!
  - Loose-beaked Parrot
column6: Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

column2: Summon your wind-up Amalj'aa minion. What is burnt may never burn, but rises again, harder and stronger.
column3: Amalj'aa blacksmith Narujj Boh of the Brotherhood of Ash began dabbling in clockwork after rescuing the mammet minion of an adventurer slain near his forges. This particular sample is the product of moons of meticulous calculations made to reproduce the telltale Amalj'aa tail sway.
column4:
My people are the
Amalj'aa, proud and
strong.
  - Loonh Gah
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Ixal minion. He believes he can fly. He believes he can touch the sky. Unfortunately he cannot.
column3: Using a mammet obtained from the Goldsmiths' Guild by the ever-resourceful Tataramu, members of the Ehcatl Nine have succeeded in creating an automaton of their own...who also happens to be as grounded as their brethren.
column4:
I heard a Wood Wailer
telling Mummy that an
Ixal teared his face off.
  - Gridanian Child
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up kobold minion. With you, she will koboldly go where no kobold has gone before.
column3: Another of 789th Order Acolyte Ba Go's masterpieces, this cuddly kobold miniature in fact houses several onzes of highly flammable firesand, designed to ignite when outward pressure is applied...such as with a tender hug.
column4:
Honestly, I will never
understand the kobolds'
sense of aesthetics.
  - R'ashaht
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Sahagin minion. He's got a trident and he's not afraid to use it.
column3: Ever the loving clutchfather, Novv had this toy crafted, complete with sharpened trident, for his infant spawnlings. When wound up, it displays various thrusts and parries to prepare the spawn for battle with their enemies.
column4:
A Sssahagin does not flail
and sssplash about so─
he rolls with the waves.
  - Clutchfather Novv
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up brickman minion. The brickman gets up and looks over as if it wants to join the party!
column3: One unexpected side effect of the Calamity has been the significant increase in aetherial rifts appearing throughout the realm. As a result, strange creatures not of this world have been popping in and out of existence without warning─one of those being the bizarre brickman.
column4:
Can ye smell it?
'Tis the scent o' profit,
my friend!
  - Beefy Businessman
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2:
Summon your wind-up Shantotto minion. But remember:
If you fail to treat her right,
she will set your pants alight.
column3: If it looks like a Lalafell, rhymes like a Lalafell, and alliterates like a Lalafell, then it is probably a Lalafell...except when it is a wind-up Shantotto. Then it is not a Lalafell.
column4:
Your judgment is quite
wise─you may yet stave
off an untimely demise.
  - Shantotto
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your wind-up Edvya minion. Sometimes moonlights as a miller girl, much to her father the sultan's chagrin.
column3: Forty years after the founding of the Thorne Dynasty, Sultan Baldric Thorne was blessed by the gods with a single daughter, Edvya, whom he loved fiercely. The history surrounding the two, now known as the “Legend of the Lost Lady” gave rise to the festival of Little Ladies' Day.
column4:
Did Princess Edvya
concern herself with glory
and riches? I think not!
  - Gossiping Girl
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppets<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up sun minion. May the sun never go down on you.  /poke to adjust elevation.
column3: Designed to provide light for road repairmen toiling during the small hours of the night, wind-up suns have become all the talk amongst Ul'dahn mesdames ever since it was discovered the extra light worked wonders at hiding unsightly blemishes and wrinkles.
column4:
We find the pages of our
memories are blank, as if
bleached by the sun.
  - Kan-E-Senna
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your plush cushion minion. Ever ready to shield your buttocks from the hardest of places.
column3: Preferring to take a more hands-on approach with his latest project, Redolent Rose of the Weavers' Guild personally researched the resilience and contour of over four score buttocks in order to create a cushion so light and fluffy, even the clouds would darken with envy.
column4:
Bumbling one spends all
day sleeping on paper-
stack pillow, yes?
  - Olmxio
column6: Removes all effects from all enemies and allies within range.

column2: Summon your Minion of Light and make true the prophecy: “When Darkness veils the world, three Minions of Light shall come.”
column3: Ancient records show that almost every Astral Era has had its own Warriors of Light─brave souls who appeared before forthcoming disasters to unite the people of that time...only to disappear once again as catastrophe rained down from the heavens.
column4:
Next you'll be telling me
you're one of the Warriors
of Light.
  - Mother Miounne

column3: Ancient records show that almost every Astral Era has had its own Warriors of Light─brave souls who appeared before forthcoming disasters to unite the people of that time...only to disappear once again as catastrophe rained down from the heavens.
column4:
Next you'll be telling me
you're one of the Warriors
of Light.
  - Mother Miounne
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column3: Ancient records show that almost every Astral Era has had its own Warriors of Light─brave souls who appeared before forthcoming disasters to unite the people of that time...only to disappear once again as catastrophe rained down from the heavens.
column4:
Next you'll be telling me
you're one of the Warriors
of Light.
  - Mother Miounne
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column3: Ancient records show that almost every Astral Era has had its own Warriors of Light─brave souls who appeared before forthcoming disasters to unite the people of that time...only to disappear once again as catastrophe rained down from the heavens.
column4:
Next you'll be telling me
you're one of the Warriors
of Light.
  - Mother Miounne
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppets<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up leader minion, who will follow you unquestioningly─for coin and country; for serenity, purity, sanctity─till sea swallows all.
column3: Originally crafted to promote the Grand Companies of Eorzea, these clockwork dolls are often rewarded to company members for exceptional service. There are three models of wind-up leaders, one to represent each of the three heads of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, and Ul'dah.
column4:
The leaders of Eorzea had
lost their way─I merely
helped them find it again.
  - Minfilia

column3: Originally crafted to promote the Grand Companies of Eorzea, these clockwork dolls are often rewarded to company members for exceptional service. There are three models of wind-up leaders, one to represent each of the three heads of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, and Ul'dah.
column4:
The leaders of Eorzea had
lost their way─I merely
helped them find it again.
  - Minfilia
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column3: Originally crafted to promote the Grand Companies of Eorzea, these clockwork dolls are often rewarded to company members for exceptional service. There are three models of wind-up leaders, one to represent each of the three heads of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, and Ul'dah.
column4:
The leaders of Eorzea had
lost their way─I merely
helped them find it again.
  - Minfilia
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column3: Originally crafted to promote the Grand Companies of Eorzea, these clockwork dolls are often rewarded to company members for exceptional service. There are three models of wind-up leaders, one to represent each of the three heads of Limsa Lominsa, Gridania, and Ul'dah.
column4:
The leaders of Eorzea had
lost their way─I merely
helped them find it again.
  - Minfilia
column6:
Reduces movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon the princely hatchling minion, the chocobo who would be king.
column3: A thoroughbred descended from the legendary Veillantif, this noble bird of Ishgard seeks a rider who will not sully his family's name.
column4:
I had a feeling you'd be
riding up on your golden
chocobo.
  - Path Companion
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your wind-up Odin minion. Guaranteed not to wipe out your entire party in one fell stroke.
column3: Many have pondered why a Dark Divinity with roots in northern mythology would wield a blade with a decidedly Far Eastern name. A popular theory is that Odin acquired the blade upon slaying an Auri warrior who was the first ever to notch his theretofore unsullied plate.
column4:
If Odin is truly come to
the Shroud, time is not on
our side.
  - Lewin
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2:
Summon your wind-up Warrior of Light minion.
“Wheresoever thou goest, so too shall Light follow.”
─Ancient benediction
column3: The brilliant blue suit of armor worn by the wind-up Warrior of Light is based upon ancient Allagan designs rediscovered in recent years by adventurers returned from the Crystal Tower.
column4:
There will be no Warriors
of Light to save you this
time.
  - Gaius van Baelsar
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Bahamut minion. This mysterious being emerged from within a broken wind-up Dalamud, and is nigh inseparable from its former prison.
column3: Despite strict orders from the Goldsmiths' Guild to <Emphasis>never</Emphasis> open up the Dalamud minion under any circumstances, someone decided to unleash their inner Pandora and release the terrors hidden within─a wind-up Bahamut...which no one from the guild recalls creating!
column4:
Bahamut can't live on 
good wishes and a smile,
so why should I?
  - Flame Private
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up moogle minion. With its button nose and fluffy pom, this clockwork moogle will make you the envy of all your friends.
column3: A creation born of 90% love and 10% jealousy (or was that 90% jealousy and 10% love?), this clockwork masterpiece was conceived after the moogles of the Black Shroud began noticing all the adventurers with their new shiny minions, and decided they were not about to be left out.
column4:
What the moogles lack in
grace, they amply make
up for in wit.
  - Jehantel
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your baby opo-opo minion. The only thing he loves more than you is a juicy sprite apple.
column3: A daring rescue from the clutches of the goblin hero Brayflox's minions is the only thing separating this opo-opo from a life of swinging free from tree to tree through the lush jungles of the Longstop...and forever trudging in the wake of the brave adventurer who “saved” him.
column4:
These beans are covered
in opo-opo droppings!
  - Mun–Tuy Cellarkeep
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your magic broom minion. For safety reasons, do not fall asleep while it is at work.
column3: While you may not hear many of the realm's mages admit it, magicking a household broom to become a self-propelled sweeping servitor (albeit one which does very little actual cleaning) is far more complicated than it sounds, requiring no fewer than seven cants of binding.
column4:
A lancer who fears to
attack is naught but a
man holding a pole.
  - Ywain
column6: Removes all effects from all enemies and allies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up succubus minion. 100% anatomically correct. Handle with tender loving care.
column3: One of countless clockwork servitors discovered in the home of a Gridanian goldsmith recently hanged for the crime of ritual summoning. It is believed while crafting the automata, he became increasingly obsessed with the void, until the darkness bid him do the unthinkable.
column4:
That succubus will drain
you to a lifeless husk!
  - Cocobygo
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monster<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your zu hatchling minion. This newborn zu has yet to exhibit aggressive or territorial behavior, but when it gets bigger...
column3: While native to the scorching deserts of the Near East, the zu will migrate to a cooler Eorzea after hatching its fledglings in the spring. Since the Calamity, however, there have been an increasing number of cases where the giant cloudkin remain in Eorzea year-round.
column4:
These birds move slow,
but they've a nasty peck!
  - Jacke
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 60.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Nanamo minion. She vehemently refuses to sit upon any shoulder but Raubahn's...and yours.
column3: This clockwork doll is a reproduction of a model first crafted in the year of the Calamity to celebrate the tenth anniversary of Nanamo Ul Namo's ascendance to the Ul'dahn throne. Seventeenth in her line, the sultana was crowned when she had seen but five summers.
column4:
Take me, Raubahn... I am
your sultana... <snore>
   - Slumbering Lalafell
column6:
Increases caster ATK by 10 and DEF by 5 for every 5% of HP lost.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Gilgamesh minion. Several arms appear to be missing, but that does not seem to otherwise hinder basic functionality.
column3: The masterwork of one of Eorzea's finest goldsmiths, this wind-up automaton, designed to resemble a close acquaintance of the smith's son, was pieced together using parts left over from other projects─his only regret being that he was unable to incorporate hip-gyrating functionality.
column4:
For Gilgamesh... It is
embiggening time!
  - Gilgamesh
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 300 to all enemies within range. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.

column2: Summon your Onion Prince minion. He would die 4 U. Or possibly cry 4 U. Or most likely make U cry. 4 U.
column3: After learning his parents married not for love, but for duty, the Onion Prince vowed he would never walk in the footsteps of his parents, and to this day promises his baseborn sweetheart, the Leek Maid, that they will run away and be wed.
column4:
Aw, bloody hells! Who's
cutting onions back
there!?
  - Buscarron
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your Eggplant Knight minion. His childhood dream to become a wizard was frowned upon by his overbearing father.
column3: House Eggplant has faithfully served the royal line of Tomato kings for eighteen generations, never once betraying the throne...until, that is, the knight of the nineteenth generation laid eyes on the fair Mandragora Queen.
column4:
If you eat too many of
this vegetable, you will
turn into one.
  - Common Wives' Tale
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critter<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Garlic Jester minion. Every breath you take will act as a reminder that your pungent pal is right behind you.
column3: The son of a traveling mummer who performed under the name Garlic Star, the jester swore he would never follow in the footsteps of his father. However, after being deemed too malodorous to serve in the royal guard, he swallowed his pride and fell back on the only trade he knew.
column4:
And this irresistible
aroma... Mmmmmmmmm...
  - Ingham
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critter<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Tomato King minion. Has issued a royal decree for the public defenestration of any and all who mistakenly claim the king is a vegetable.
column3: After the flames of the Calamity rendered Lord Tomato a king without a kingdom, the ruby red regent packed up his seeds and set out on a journey to find a new land to rule. He currently roams the realm recruiting any taproot, tuber, or corm who will follow his standard.
column4:
It is apparently a rogue,
outcast from its kin, a
stranger in a strange land.
  - Tomaj
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Though wed to the Tomato King in a move to strengthen the bond of houses Tomato and Mandragora, the queen longs to steal away with her one true love─the Eggplant Knight. What will become of this forbidden romance!? Summon the Mandragora Queen minion today and find out!
column3: Destined to a life with a man she did not love, nary a night passed when the Mandragora Queen did not dream of throwing herself into the sea's eternal embrace...until, that is, she laid eyes on the noble Eggplant Knight.
column4:
I want to be waist-deep
in little white mandragora
limbs!
  - Yellowjacket
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critter<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon your wind-up Y'shtola minion. If we are to take her word for it, the Circle of Knowing Archon has seen but twenty-three summers.
column3: Nearly half of the coin provided to the Goldsmiths' Guild for the crafting of this wind-up doll bearing the likeness of Scion of the Seventh Dawn Y'shtola was paid to Atelier Fen-Yll for hand-sewn leather boots matching those worn by the enigmatic Archon.
column4:
Gods forfend...
   - Y'shtola
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your magic wind-up onion knight minion. An accurate representation of the soldiers who once made up the greater portion of the Allagan Imperial Army.
column3: If Sons of Saint Coinach anthropogeographer Rammbroes is to be believed, towards the end of their civilization, the Allagans began using automata such as this to fight their wars (which had been deemed inhumane, yet ultimately necessary to spread imperial peace).
column4:
By the onion!
  - Bloezoeng
column6:
Renders action party immune to all attacks.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your treasure box minion. It is unknown what manner of spirit possesses this tiny treasure chest, but the fact that it will not hesitate to nip at the fingers of any who try and pry it open is painfully evident.
column3: Originally used by an Eorzean Alliance paymaster to store Allied Seals...until the box began eating them. She sold the box in hopes of recouping some of her losses (skimming off adventurer rewards to cover the rest...until she was caught and sentenced to a public flogging).
column4:
A pirate don't abandon
'is treasures!
  - Ahtzapfyn
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your tiny tapir minion. Natives of the New World claim that tapirs grow by devouring the dreams of their unsuspecting owners. And now you know what to expect.
column3: Before it was realized that the tapirs were, in fact, consuming the dreams of their owners, several hundred were sold to Ul'dahn nobles seeking a better night's sleep. Surprisingly, there were few complaints from buyers, even after learning the truth.
column4:
Our dreams are
what sustain us.
  - Gundobald
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Nana bear minion. Pundits claim bears to be the deadliest beasts in the realm─obviously having never stared into <Emphasis>this</Emphasis> cute cub's nebulous eyes.
column3: The Nana bear's origins can be traced back to Ul'dahn princess Nanakko who, on her eighth nameday, asked her father for a bear. Despite a realm-wide search, no bears were found, and so the Goldsmiths' Guild was commissioned to craft one from a drawing found in an ancient bestiary.
column4:
There isn't enough honey
in all the Yard to satisfy
that sweet-toothed sellary.
  - Honey Yard Hivekeep
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your miniature minecart minion. Best when ridden in abandoned mines and temples of doom.
column3: Despite adamant claims by Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern that their donation of over five score carts to the orphans of Stonesthrow was a simple act of charity, opponents of the guild insist it was a scheme to recruit inexpensive child labor for Thanalan's myriad mines.
column4:
Mines mine!
Mines all miiiiiiiiine!
  - Biggy the Spriggan
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your nutkin minion. That nutkins are infamous for being shy and timid creatures shows that this brave beastkin comes complete with a pair of iron acorns on him.
column3: Inspired by the words of Millith Ironheart, this daring squirrel longs to travel the realm in search of the legendary golden acorn, and hopes that trailing in your shadow will ensure that he isn't eaten before he discovers the mother lode.
column4:
I had no idea squirrels
could bite so hard!
  - Arold
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, reduces the movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Minfilia minion. Unlike the real Minfilia, this one actually accompanies you on your adventures.
column3: This clockwork automaton has been crafted at the behest of the Adventurers' Guild in celebration of the Rising, Eorzea's annual celebration of rebirth. All linkshell privileges have been revoked so one not need dread incessant calls throughout the small hours of night.
column4:
...Hello? Hello? Can you
hear me? It is I, Minfilia.
  - Minfilia
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Thancred minion. 200% more dreamy than previous models.
column3: This clockwork automaton has been crafted at the behest of the Adventurers' Guild in celebration of the Rising, Eorzea's annual celebration of rebirth. Reports of crazed Thancred fans stalking the summoned servitors are more common than one might believe.
column4:
I suppose any name is as
good as another, though
most call me Thancred.
  - Thancred
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your model magitek bit minion. An exact 1:9 scale replica of a ceruleum-powered magitek bit (Ultima Weapon action figure not included).
column3: This miracle of modern mechanics is actually a miracle of ancient Allagan mechanics reverse engineered and then modified with advanced Garlean magitek technology.
column4:
The Empire owes
its might to magitek.
  - Yda
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your puff of darkness minion. When standing nearby, prithee refrain from coughing, sneezing, waving, flailing, or performing any other means of wild gesticulation, lest the puff be lost for eternity.
column3: When this automaton resembling one crafted by a goldsmith hanged for dabbling in the dark arts was discovered, it prompted authorities to exhume the recently buried body. This, however, only confirmed their worst fears─that the coffin was empty.
column4:
What I do not smother,
I devour. What I cannot
devour, I destroy.
  - The Cloud of Darkness
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your naughty nanka minion. Like its parent, the ninki nanka, this slippery wavekin will breed like a rabbit if left unsupervised.
column3: Instead of laying her eggs in a pond or river where they might be devoured by predators, the ninki nanka female deposits her offspring upon the back of the father, who then carries and protects the brood until it is ready to face the world on its own. Unless, however, one falls off.
column4:
Shiiiiiiny! Preeeeeetty!
Need more eeeeeeggs!
Eeeeeeggs!
  - Giggity the Spriggan
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your panda cub minion. Untrained in arts both martial and magical, but as scrumptiously adorable as chicken glazed in a tangy orange reduction.
column3: So popular are pandas in the Far East, that there are tales of the creatures being promoted to powerful positions within local governmental agencies. This particular mechanical reproduction is thought to have been brought to Eorzea by a Doman wise man.
column4:
Beings held as gods also
exist in what you call the
Far East.
  - Yugiri
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Ultros minion. A fraction of the size, yet every bit as annoying as the real thing. Be forewarned: once Ultros shows up, he's liable to stick around.
column3: One can only imagine the time and effort master goldsmith Godbert put into the creation of this lifelike recreation of a lecherous purple octopus.
column4:
Muscle-heads? Hate 'em!
  - Ultros
column6:
Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Hoary the Snowman minion. Hoary the Snowman was a jolly happy soul, without a pipe, and without a nose, and two eyes made out of something other than coal. Probably slag.
column3: While no one knows the exact origins of Hoary the Snowman and the legends surrounding this animated mass of ice and snow, the gifting of dolls created in his likeness to good girls and boys is not uncommon during the Starlight Celebration.
column4:
On your feet, Hoary!
  - Coultenet
column6:
Grants action party the ability to deal extra damage to Arcana Stones.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your heavy hatchling minion. Currently, “baby fat” is the prevailing excuse for this cherubic chick's gigant-like girth.
column3: It would be foolish to believe that a chocobo could achieve this size dining on greens alone, regardless of how many hundreds of bushels were devoured...in a single sitting. Chicken bones found beneath the chick's bedding suggest he may have a taste for his succulent cousins.
column4:
I cannot deny what you say is
true any more than I can deny
a chocobo's arse is yellow.
  - Path Companion
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your wind-up Yda minion. Comes complete with irremovable mask.
column3: Due to her apparent lack of wit and tendency to be in the wrong place at the wrong time, people are quick to forget that Yda is not only a Scion of the Seventh Dawn, but also an Archon of the Circle of Knowing, handpicked by the legendary Louisoix to serve Eorzea.
column4:
The great beyond!
I do believe we're
dead, Papalymo.
   - Yda
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Papalymo minion. Comes complete with irremovable smirk.
column3: After a clerical error resulted in a sizable windfall for the organization, Scions of the Seventh Dawn coinkeeper Tataru took it upon herself to use the funds to commission wind-up automata crafted in the likeness of her own favorite members─Papalymo being the first.
column4:
He'd sooner swallow
his staff than admit
that he's wrong.
   - Yda
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your wind-up Urianger minion. When the senary moon did wane, there sounded a garrulous and convoluted monologue. A new minion had roused, one whose identity lieth within our ken.
column3: After commissioning several other wind-up Archons, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn coinkeeper realized that she had almost enough gil to order a seventh...almost. And so the robed and hooded Urianger was crafted without hair or other anatomical features to keep the cost down.
column4:
Frustratingly, Urianger's
words leave rather a lot
to interpretation.
   - Papalymo
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your fat cat minion. Despite convincing research by top academics from around the realm and beyond, most Miqo'te scholars refuse to believe that there may be some ancestral connection between their race and cats (fat or not).
column3: Born in an unmarked alley in an unnamed town, this poor creature had to hunt the mean streets just to stay alive...until learning that following retainers and feeding off the slaughter left in their wakes was a safer, easier way to a full belly.
column4:
When the master's away,
the cat will play.
  - Miqo'te Retainer
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critter<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Littlefoot minion. This particular yeti is content in knowing that bigger is not always necessarily better.
column3: When discovered by your retainer on a foray deep into the highlands of Coerthas, this miniature monstrosity was both cold and hungry (though the former condition most likely did not affect him much), and a bowl of hot broth was all it took to lure him from the forest back home.
column4:
It is good to see you
on your feet again.
  - Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your mummy's little mummy minion. While as cute as a button, remember, mummies are ultimately embalmed corpses damned to eternal thralldom in the land of the living. Have fun.
column3: It is believed that the ancient technique of mummification─which involved embalming, organ removal, wrapping, and the burial in a multilayered sarcophagus─was an expensive undertaking. That it was performed on a child can attest to his parents' devotion.
column4:
I told you, I'm
<Emphasis>not</Emphasis> your mummy!
  - Ul'dahn Citizen
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your model <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis> minion. Designed to boldly go where you have gone before.
column3: The original <Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis> was designed and built while Garlond family prodigy Cid was still working as a military engineer for the Garlean Empire. The aft crane─intended for the loading of imperial weaponry─was added to the airship in the days before Cid's defection.
column4:
<Emphasis>Enterprise</Emphasis>, engage!
   - Alphinaud
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up delivery moogle minion. For when you absolutely, positively require moogle accompaniment.
column3: The never-ending flow of adventurers into Eorzea has placed quite a burden on the realm's little letter carriers. To help lighten their load, several acolytes at the Goldsmiths' Guild volunteered their time to create a veritable army of miniature mail moogles.
column4:
Behold, for I shall now
perform for you the moogle
dance of inimitable integrity!
   - Delivery Moogle
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 25%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your assassin fry minion. There was an old betta who swallowed a fry. No one knows why it swallowed the fry, but for some reason, the fry can now fly.
column3: After several turns of the sun sloshing about in the depths of a ninja betta's belly, this freshly hatched fry has given up swimming altogether and taken to the skies. How spending time in a belly can inspire a fish to flight is something only one who has spent time in a belly can know.
column4:
They say never to look
a gift fish in the mouth.
  - Sisipu
column6: Delivers an attack 5 times the potency of the caster's ATK.

column2: Summon your demon box minion. There is no better way to tell a special someone “Thank you for attending my Ceremony of Eternal Bonding” than by giving them a sentient box that may or may not devour their pets.
column3:
Lacking the spells required to animate a gift in the same manner in which the ancients animated bricks, the crafter of this quaint creation simply cut a pair of holes into a wooden box and slipped it on a spriggan.
Problem solved.
column4:
That Miqo'te lass said
someone'd be bringin' me a
gift what I couldn't refuse.
  - Drogo
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your water imp minion. Legend states these strange creatures can only survive on land as long as the plate atop their heads remains wet.
column3: Even a child knows that there are no such things as water imps...but if that is true, then what in the world could this undeniably imp-like creature be? An undocumented species of gigantoad/salamander hybrid? Or perhaps simply the hapless victim of a misdirected Imp spell?
column4:
Not <Emphasis>more</Emphasis> imps!
They'll have all our honey!
  - Befuddled Beekeeper
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Louisoix minion. The Seventh Astral Era is secure as long as the Archon is ever at our sides.
column3: When asked why the Goldsmiths' Guild began manufacture of the wind-up delivery moogles before even drawing up designs for their wind-up Louisoix─the single greatest hero in the history of history─Guildmaster Serendipity replied, “Moogles are cuter.”
column4:
I swear by Louisoix's beard,
I'll tear the skin from his─
  - Geva
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon Midgardsormr. Not the big one. The little one.
column3: Father of Dragons, Keeper of the Lake, Bane of the XIVth Legion─while it is difficult to believe the yalm-long pup could be any of these things, he assures you his current form is only temporary while he awaits the reconstruction of a new corporeal vessel.
column4:
Midgardsormr was a king
amongst kings who reigned
for centuries on end...
  - Minfilia
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your Doman magpie minion. Approximately 3.14159 times more intelligent than the average swallow.
column3: Magpies have historically been portrayed as loyal messengers of Menphina, bearing the word of the Lover's favor in war. There are some generals even today who will wait to advance their armies until one of the birds has been sighted on their side of the battlefield.
column4:
Fancy some feathers...
bird brain?
   - Gilgamesh
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Enkidu minion. That green is not coming out, even with multiple washings.
column3: Legend has that Gilgamesh first found Enkidu while searching for a meal. Without the means to make a fire, he attempted to eat the fowl raw, only to find himself the victim of a furious counterattack. Impressed by the bird's tenacity, he promptly made him his pet.
column4:
Enkidu, do you hear me!?
ENKIIIDUUUUUUUUUUUU!
  - Gilgamesh
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Violet minion. Touched by a primal and corrupted to the core...yet adorable nonetheless.
column3: After being harried by their hostile sylvan cousins one time too many, the sylphs of Little Solace turned to a traveling goldsmith from faraway Ul'dah to help them create an automated decoy that might keep the touched ones away.
column4:
This one is in the mood for
dancing! And prancing!
  - Hostile Sylph
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up founder minion. Four score and many more years ago, the Amalj'aa founding fathers dreamed of a day when in their footsteps would walk adorable minions. That day has finally come.
column3: Amalj'aa legend tells of Whiteknuckle Kerigg Roh─undefeated on the battlefield, he is a hero to many, including Warleader Hamujj Gah. The champion is also father of the brawling style of martial arts utilized by the beast tribe to this day.
column4:
Do you know, honored ally,
what is most distasteful to
the Amalj'aa?
  - Narujj Boh
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Dezul Qualan minion. It is said Ixali engineer Dezul Qualan began crafting war dirigibles after having a vision of ninety-nine red balloons floating over the Black Shroud.
column3: The last time Ixali engineer Dezul Qualan was seen was the day he boarded his greatest creation─a war balloon thrice the size of any ever built, and equipped with enough provisions to last a man a full moon in the clouds. His destination: the floating continent of Ayatlan.
column4:
Soar once again, we shall.
Within <Emphasis>Dezul Qualan</Emphasis>,
our salvation lies!
  - Sezul Totoloc
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your wind-up kobolder minion. Bolder than a wind-up kobold, yet not any older.
column3: Unsatisfied with the explosive power of his first creation, 789th Order Acolyte Ba Go returned to his laboratories deep within the faction dig to create the “kobolder” (a name he was quite pleased with), only to see it sold for scrap by his dim-witted brethren.
column4:
Doings of small minds
and grubby hands are
of no interest to Ba Go.
  - Acolyte Ba Go
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 300 to all enemies within range. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.
