column3: Seeing Limsa Lominsa crawling with wind-up Ifrits, Titans, Ramuhs, even Ravanas, the Bismarck proprietor wondered why there were still no automata designed in the likeness of his establishment's namesake, and so commissioned one made.
column4:
The Bismarck is as good as mine.
   - H'mhasi Tia
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Shield by 70%. No effect if Shield is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your wind-up Hien minion. Be proud, my new owner. Be proud.
column3: Under imperial rule, Doman dollmakers were forbidden from crafting automata such as the kiyofusa, but this did not stop one brave soul from honoring the popular young Lord Hien with a mammet in his likeness. Its creator can rightly be proud!
column4:
There is no denying that
he has a presence...
   - Haname
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Ravana minion. Low on low he stands, gazing up to see.
column3: Desiring that the tale of Ravana's clash with the Warrior of Light be preserved for posterity, a Gnath historian commissioned the Weavers' Guild to recreate the Lord of the Hive as a mammet. Comes complete with Chandrahas and fierce love of battle.
column4:
O Lord Ravana! Master of the
Sacred Blades! Wrath of the
Colony! Conqueror of the World!
   - Gnath Priest
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Kojin minion. Is it green? Is it blue? Or...is it neither?
column3: A mammet made in the likeness of the vessel for the kami Tsukumo, but given a green rather than blue coat of paint in order to differentiate it from the actual divinity. The Blue Kojin are hopeful of making a tidy profit by selling scores of these in Kugane.
column4:
Tsukumo is no ordinary
puppet. He is of the divine!
   - Kabuto
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon your mameshiba minion. Who let the newborn miniature Far Eastern canine specimen out? Who, who, who, who, who!?
column3: An unscrupulous merchant passed this pup off as a rare species of miniature dog known as the mameshiba. Such a thing does not exist. Rather than have the hapless owners discover the deception when it grows, it was trained to run away.
column4:
There's a smile made
of puppy fat!
   - Delivery Moogle
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your tengu doll minion. And you know what they say about the size of a doll's nose.
column3: A doll made in the likeness of a legendary Far Eastern creature, surprisingly animated for an inanimate object─a mystery Far Eastern folk would attribute to the mischievous tengu. Much like how a coveted piece of gear boasting five materia slots suddenly becomes a doll.
column4:
How do you hope
to survive with even
more beaks to feed?
   - Sanu Vanu
column6:
Reduces movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up Matanga minion. This is not Matanga. Matanga is graceful.
column3: A mammet made to resemble a Matanga found in the Hidden Canals of Uznair. Originally clothed, it was divested of its modesty by thieves targeting the jewels that adorned its lavish garments, hence its embarrassment. If only someone would cover up its shame. Shame. Shame.
column4:
To think you beat
a Matanga with
just your fists.
   - Impressed Dotharl
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Ramza minion. Stands ready to fight for truth, justice, and the Ivalician way.
column3: Designed after Ramza Beoulve─unsung champion of Ivalician legend and not the son of the exiled Majestic Theater Company principal─this mammet's creation was commissioned by Jenomis cen Lexentale to pay honor to the true hero of the Zodiac Brave Story.
column4:
Put that damnable thing
down, Ramza. You're not
helping matters!
   - Jenomis cen Lexentale
column6:
Renders action party immune to all attacks.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your koala joey minion. Shows no signs of stress or crotch rot, so hug away.
column3: This small ursine creature dropped onto the retainer who was cutting down its tree and has apparently decided to see the world. Though ordinarily placid, it can be savage when threatened, and folk are cautioned against─ Awww, look at the adorable little critter!
column4:
Fool is the man who
calls a koala a bear
within its hearing.
   - Ancient Saying
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your salt & pepper seal minion. What a seal, what a mighty good seal.
column3: None can say how this seal pup came to be at Loch Seld, but the person who first saw it took to calling it “salt” for the briny water, then someone else came along and added “pepper,” because why not. The rest, as they say, is history.
column4:
Love makes for the
best seasoning.
   - Gildon
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 70% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your axolotl eft minion. Because there truly is nothing more adorable than an oddly Lalafellin face on the body of a moist, frilled salamander.
column3: The retainer who reeled in this specimen claims it is the fabled hundred-eyed axolotl, but at a glance it is short at least ninety-eight. Nor would the man say where he found the creature. For now, it shall be called an “axolotl eft” until such time as naturalists decide what it actually is.
column4:
The plot thickens like a
dollop of salamander oil.
   - Godbert
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your wind-up Ixion minion. A horse is a horse, of course. Except when it is Ixion.
column3: In a bid to lure brave (or foolish) adventurers to hunt the legendary steed Ixion, the people of Gyr Abania pitched in coin to have this mammet produced─a handsome reward, they believe, for risking grisly death by impalement and/or lightning.
column4:
Brave one! Your
loyal steed awaits!
   - Voyce
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your wind-up Shinryu minion. Exhibits an almost preternatural urge to hide in treasure chests and guard powerful weapons.
column3: The designer of this mammet was tasked with recreating the dread-filled moment when Shinryu gains his freedom, bursting forth from a cocoon of light. The result is a rather loose interpretation, to say the least.
column4:
I should very much like
to see this “Shinryu”
creature for myself.
   - Nero tol Scaeva
column6: Renders both ally and enemy Shields and Search Eyes inoperable. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.

column2: Summon your dress-up Raubahn minion. Detachable arm optional.
column3: Ostensibly produced to commemorate Ala Mhigo's liberation, this avatar of the Flame General was originally meant to serve as an apology for the campaign's troubled start. To that end, it was said to have been programmed to beg forgiveness a dozen different ways.
column4:
Wait till the Flame General
hears about this!
   - M'naago
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Ananta minion. Why did it have to be a snake?
column3: The ex-Gatekeeper sapper who crafted this doll claims her model was a recently molted Sarisha─new scales glistening in the sun. Proceeds from the sale of each piece are used as remuneration to those who aid the battlemaids in their endeavors.
column4:
Someone bring the snake!
   - Fordola rem Lupis
column6: Restores 200 HP to all allies within range (250 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon your private moai minion. It's watching you, watching you, watching you.
column3: Carved from the remnants of a larger statue found deep beneath the Ruby Sea, the reasons why or even how it can propel itself remain unknown. Rumors of bright rings pouring forth from the effigy's mouth, however, are largely exaggerated.
column4:
Either that was a trick
of the light, or that statue
just moved...
   - Shigure
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>gadget<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your white whittret minion. Once you pop...
column3: This young male weasel with fur as yellow? as the winter's first snow once dreamed of becoming a pupil of the great auspice Kamaitachi. However, upon witnessing the Warrior of Light's prowess in Hells' Lid, he decided he would be better off siding with the latter.
column4:
Don't talk to me! Talk
to the cat...or the weasel.
   - Tataru
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your motley egg minion. The tiny Archon inside is certain to kickstart your heart.
column3: As thanks for aiding Jihli Aliapoh in the retrieval of several stolen eggs, the original Egg Dreamer has gifted you with an eggspertly crafted automaton featuring Radcliffe the Red, famed first Archon of the Sixth Umbral Era.
column4:
Personally, I've always
had a thing for a motley.
   - Cornell
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Kefka minion. Just can't believe it? Believe it!
column3: Other than a vague claim by Y'shtola that the doll you discovered in Omega's Sigmascape seems “eerily familiar,” none of your companions can recall ever hearing of a wicked jester known as Kefka, be it in history books or children's tales.
column4:
Now, if you'll excuse me,
I have an appointment
with Kefka!
   - Locke Cole
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Magnai minion. Ever in search of true love.
column3: When, after countless moons, their most radiant brother could still not find a suitable wife, several of the Oronir visited Kugane to have poppets created in Magnai's likeness. As of this writing, the outspoken leader remains alone.
column4:
You're not related or
something, are you?
   - Lyse
column6: Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your aurelia polyp minion. Lighter than air─er...water.
column3: Hitching a ride in the ballast tank of a submersible proved an enlightening experience for this infant wavekin, allowing it to listen in on the incessant mumblings of the vessel's pilot─a mammet voyager tasked with taking an audio log of all discoveries made.
column4:
Tonight we will feast on the
jellyfish while my jealous fish
of a brother drinks in his tears!
   - Nortmoen
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your Byakko cub minion. Got to be the fuzziest.
column3: While not the actual progeny of the thousand-year-old auspice lord, this eponymous recreation (in newborn form) is sought after by Hingans hoping to see their luck turn for the better.
column4:
Genbu may be the oldest,
but Byakko's got to be the
fuzziest.
   - Kamaitachi
column6: Knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Fafnir minion. Protective eyewear highly recommended.
column3: Why the scholar who crafted this mechanical marvel felt that an already deadly dragon need carry a sword (and a legendary one, at that) remains unclear. When questioned, he simply refused to alter the design and began muttering about “drop rates.”
column4:
Those hard scales, those
claws...that puny body. Are you
some kind of lesser dragon, kupo?
   - Mogzin
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Mithra minion. Opinions on how Miqo'te rate compared to their supposed ancestors are best kept to oneself.
column3: A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict the Mithra─supposed ancestor of the Miqo'te. She wears a traditional scorpion harness rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by her Sharlayan creator.
column4:
Looking to make
a new frrriend, are we?
   - Nanaa Mihgo
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Prince of Anemos minion. Cute and cudgely.
column3: Much to the chagrin of his father─the Lord of Anemos─the young heir has yet to outgrow the odd habit of concealing cudgels and using them to bludgeon anyone who dares question his merits. Thankfully, an absence of thew leaves his lively blows lacking.
column4:
By the Twelve, what a hideous,
monstrous abomination!
   - The Impresario
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your komainu minion. Part lion, part dog, all lion-dog.
column3: Believed to ward the places from intruders with evil intent, statues of these mythical lion-dog creatures are oft erected at the gates of sacred locations such as shrines. When paired with another, they will always face forward.
column4:
Bright as a lamp,
brave as a lion.
   - Haermaga
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your Gold Whisker minion. Beckons you to enter his barrel of sin, but don't go in.
column3: This gaudy rendition of a Namazu is not actually solid gold, but merely a wooden automaton adorned with gold leaf. Its creator, however, hopes that will be enough to fool trade ships from the West to import his “lucky catfish.”
column4:
Within these whiskers
lies unbound potential.
   - Old Namazu Master
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your magic monkey minion. King of monkeys. Equal of heaven. Inspirer of “awww.”
column3: A miniature doppelganger of Qitian Dasheng magically brought into being by the ancient auspice himself. Originally used by the monkey king to cozen corrival and companion alike, now it merely serves to act adorable as it hovers nearby its new owner.
column4:
It seems this year
shall belong to the
monkey after all!
   - Saru Doshin
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your clockwork lantern minion. Hands-free illumination for the busy insomniac.
column3: Seeing as collaborations are now all the rage in Eorzea, it did not take long for the tinkers of Eshtaime's Lapidaries to find their way to Frondale's Phrontistery to see what madness their collective minds could conceive. (A lantern. They made a lantern.)
column4:
They can scarce make do
without their lanterns.
   - Armelle
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your frilled dragon minion. Also known as the <Emphasis>chlamydosaurus</Emphasis> but...uh, yeah.
column3: Tree-dwellers by nature, frilled dragons only descend to hunt, using their powerful rear legs to propel them forward at speeds that rival most Lalafell. When intimidated, they will spread out the spiked frills adorning their necks, hoping to frighten would-be predators.
column4:
Are you some kind of
lesser dragon, kupo?
   - Mogzin
column6:
Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Cirina minion. Hungry for divine guidance. Also buuz.
column3: Commissioned for the Rising to promote interest in Xaela culture, this fully operational automaton was designed with painstaking detail, using the Mol youth Cirina as a model.
column4:
She's braver than she looks.
   - Lyse
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Sadu minion. Will most likely not call any of your companions a stunted chuluu.
column3: There once lived a young Dotharli warrior who dreamed of taking the khatun into his arms and, well, doing things that young Dotharli warriors dream of doing. He quickly realized he valued his life and instead crafted this less imposing stand-in.
column4:
Is the khatun woman
or man? A stupid question.
She is Sadu.
   - Koko
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 300 to all enemies within range. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.

column2: Summon your copycat bulb minion. The only companion you need if you want no other companions.
column3: Swaddled in crimson cloth and transfixed with an all-too-familiar earring, this shambling seedkin─seemingly fallen from the infamously fetid Cassie─reeks of rotting rutabagas and sour spirits.
column4:
The sapling is well on its
way to becoming a tree.
   - Beatin
column6:
Binds all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up Tarutaru minion. Remarks relating to a certain people's stature and the diminutiveness thereof are best kept to oneself.
column3: A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict the Tarutaru─supposed ancestor of the Lalafell. She wears a gaudy vermilion cloak rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by her Sharlayan creator.
column4:
Ages ago, there lived a female
mage of no small repute who
was known by all sorts of
unsavory epithets.
   - Gerolt
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your wind-up Tsukuyomi minion. Barren waters, heed unto the tide.
column3: Conscripted into the imperial army, only to be handed over to Eorzean Alliance officials in an unreported prisoner exchange, one humble goldsmith celebrated his regained freedom how most goldsmiths do─he crafted a lifelike replica of the Lady of the Moon, Tsukuyomi.
column4:
And I am but the moon.
   - Lebrassoir
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Zhloe minion. Cannot thank you enough, but will certainly try.
column3: Impressed with Zhloe's tireless efforts at the orphanage, a craftsman employed by Rowena's House of Splendors created an automaton version of the altruist and gifted it to her sister, Khloe...who silently added it to her table of rewards.
column4:
But deep down, I knew that
Mummy and Daddy were
never coming back.
   - T'kebbe
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon your Construct 8 minion. Batteries not included.
column3: Inoperative when discovered in the Clockwork City of Goug, the queer device whirred to life when a crystal was inserted under its chest plate. As long as the crystal is not replaced with auracite, the automaton should prove harmless.
column4:
A construct born of
desperation and denial.
   - Penitent Heretic
column6: Delivers an attack 5 times the potency of the caster's ATK.

column2: Summon your Palico minion. Very punny.
column3: Hailing from a land so distant it does not appear on any map, this catlike hunter has traveled to far eastern Othard in pursuit of his quarry─the fire-breathing Rathalos. How he came to fight by your side is a story better told over a roast leg of wyvern.
column4:
They allowed him to bring the
sum of his skills to bear...or
maybe <Emphasis>cat</Emphasis>, on his foes.
   - Gerolt
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Poogie minion. Beloved by hunters, though the feeling is not always mutual.
column3: Many a hunter from lands both near and far has proclaimed this tiny piglet “cute enough to eat.” Not literally, of course. Alright, sometimes literally, but not this time. There will be no eating of Poogie, and that is final.
column4:
Ungodly swine! I would sooner
<Emphasis>die</Emphasis> than surrender to you!
   - Vault Priest
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your attendee #777 minion. Wasshoi, yes, yes.
column3: Gyoshin labored through several nights to fincraft this tiny Namazu (though the happi stitchwork is clearly Gyorei's). He intended to make it in the likeness of the 777th attendee, but soon lost count, so model selection was ultimately random.
column4:
I am happy to have met some-
one so delici─deft of hand.
   - Cirina
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your scarlet peacock minion. Prettier than your average peacock, and several times as flammable.
column3: Peafowl have long been admired in the Far East for their brilliant plumage, but it is their penchant for hunting venomous vilekin that has earned them reverence typically reserved for kami. As such, effigies of the birds are believed to bring their owners good fortune.
column4:
There will come a time when
we must confront Suzaku.
   - Genbu
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Alpha minion. Kweh-ing along under some distant sky.
column3: Crafted at the Garlond Ironworks, this miniature reproduction of your faithful (if not somewhat deformed) companion was gifted to you by engineer Jessie Jaye upon your triumphant return from the Alphascape.
column4:
Well, Alpha certainly
seems keen.
   - Cid
column6: Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

column2: Summon your OMG minion. Weird. Technological. Fascinating.
column3: Despite a striking resemblance to the extra-dimensional mechanical monstrosity that nearly ended your life, this miniature model of Omega does naught but follow in your wake. Wedge of the Garlond Ironworks posits it may have been created to observe your behavior.
column4:
Soon, Omega, soon...
I will see you rise again!
   - Nero tol Scaeva
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while inflicting a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up G'raha Tia minion. The future is where his destiny awaits.
column3: In order to fund the expedition to the Syrcus Trench, Tataru crafted this series of automaton, modeled upon a certain Archon, the tales of whom she heard from Rammbroes.
column4:
A man could study for two
lifetimes and only learn
half of what you know.
   - Cid
column6:
Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your Little Yin minion. Turn around.
column3: One half of a pair of (literally) animated decorations you stumbled across during the All Saints' Wake festivities. Members of the Continental Circus are at a loss as to why this sullen specter appears to have a will of its own, though “possession” is high on their list of theories.
column4:
Are we really sleepin' at
a graveyard? 'Cause I'm
afraid of ghosts...
   - Hal
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your Little Yang minion. Every now and then he gets a little bit closer.
column3: One half of a pair of (literally) animated decorations you stumbled across during the All Saints' Wake festivities. Members of the Continental Circus are at a loss as to why this spry specter appears to have a will of its own, though “possession” is high on their list of theories.
column4:
Everyone'll think you a ghost!
   - Erapi Taropi
column6:
Renders action party immune to all attacks.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Cloud minion. Sharp hair, don't care.
column3: At first glance, it appears that the artisan took numerous liberties in this rendition of the legendary hero─the distinct lack of upper-body muscle mass suggesting Cloud would have been unable to even lift a weapon the size of the Buster Sword, let alone brandish it over his head.
column4:
...something.
   - Cloud
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 380 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Aerith minion. The future ith not only yourth.
column3: A somber reimagining of the ill-fated flowermonger who would set off on a journey to discover herself, only to find more than she bargained for. What is wind-up can never die.
column4:
This guy are sick.
   - Aerith
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up Tifa minion. Not the wrong person.
column3: A gravity-defying rendition of the legendary bartending brawler, carved with tender loving care by a seven-fingered craftsman who is oft overheard mumbling to himself, “Words aren't the only way to tell someone how you feel.”
column4:
Fu, fu, fu... Be nice, Don.
   - Tifa
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your mudpie minion. At last, portable filth.
column3: A thick, brown mass of living effluence squeezed forth from one of the horror Tokkapchi's many hidden orifices. Though the squirt stinks of sopping sod, one might find themselves pressed to deny the amorphous alluvium is anything but adorable.
column4:
I was almost certain you'd
want to muddy the waters.
   - Jessie
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 60 to all enemies within range while reducing movement speed by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your bridesmoogle minion. What is a blushing bride without a dutiful bridesmoogle to scatter petals in her general vicinity?
column3: Moogles serving the Sanctum of the Twelve claim the magicked poppets (provided with purchase of a lavish Ceremony of Eternal Bonding) are guaranteed to bring happiness. Conveniently offer no refunds if you do not hap upon said happiness.
column4:
Wh-What have you done
with my bride!?
   - Vannes
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 10.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Elvaan minion. Remarks relating to a certain people's perpetually dour facial expressions are best kept to oneself.
column3: A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict an Elvaan─possible (but improbable) ancestor of the Elezen. He wears a blue cotehardie rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by his Sharlayan creator.
column4:
Curious pointed ears...
I wonder where they could
have come from, kupo?
   - Mogleo
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your dhalmel calf minion. Oddly short yet alarmingly tall.
column3: Considering this young specimen was most likely bred in captivity for the purpose of research, it is nothing short of a miracle that the calf has managed to survive the harsh environment of Eureka for as long as it has.
column4:
Yes, you─with the long neck.
   - Tsukumo
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your capybara pup minion. Loves bath time, and you.
column3: Known in Hingashi as the “onitenjikunezumi” (quite liberally translated as “Near Eastern demon rat”), this rodent auspice of unknown age has developed a fondness for Far Eastern hot springs, and will spend days in the restorative waters if not reminded to come out and eat.
column4:
Such simple creatures, rats.
   - Charibert
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your baby gremlin minion. Feeding after midnight may result in injury. Yours.
column3: Be not fooled by a gremlin's snow-white fur, for its intentions are as black as the night in which it thrives. Unlike more common stock, this particular breed appears to be resistant to both light and water, making them perfect pets for someone who doesn't mind a bit of mischief.
column4:
Thin skin and big
mouths make for an
uneasy combination.
   - Hunter-scholar
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your Conditional Virtue minion. Cuddle not to dullness; coddle not to elevation.
column3: From a pulsating mass of aetherial flesh sloughed off the Eurekan elemental Absolute Virtue did rise this uncanny facsimile, identical to its progenitor in every way─every way, that is, except size and, well, absoluteness.
column4:
Men measure virtue
in many ways.
   - Yayaroku
column6:
Increases caster ATK by 10 and DEF by 5 for every 5% of HP lost.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your yukinko snowflake minion. Falling, falling, falling, falling, falling...falling on his head.
column3: The yukinko's woven headdress serves not only to protect the creature from the elements, but spare it the embarrassment of having its nakedness exposed unto the world─not that any sane man would dare peek under the straw, lest he risk eternal damnation.
column4:
It is the enemy that weighs
on me─snow, rather than fire.
   - Martiallais
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 70 to all enemies within range while reducing movement speed by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your dress-up Tataru minion. Say what you will, she wears it well.
column3: To thank those adventurers who have come to her aid while in Kugane, Tataru Taru of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn has been presenting her knights in shining armor with handcrafted replicas of...herself, fully clad in the finest silks from Bukyo.
column4:
Tataru's expression grows
ever darker each time I
see her pass by.
   - Slafborn
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up weapon minion. Somewhat buggy.
column3: Scaled-down replicas of armored weapons have long been mass-produced by the Garlean Imperial Army in an effort to train new recruits in the proper methods of magitek deployment and repair.
column4:
Be on your guard─
he's known to be armed!
   - Brass Blade
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wind-up Qalyana minion. She may or may not break through the borderline.
column3: The ex-Gatekeeper who crafted this doll claims her model was a Qalyana battlemaid who awoke from her reverie to join Alpa in the headstrong Vira's endeavor to protect the realm. She hopes it serves to strengthen the bond 'twixt the Ananta tribes.
column4:
The Qalyana are another
Ananta tribe─the strongest
and the most influential.
   - M'naago
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Redback minion. Don't tell mom the Kojin minion's red.
column3: A master craftsman hailing from the Kojin of the Blue conceived this miniature automaton with the hopes that it might one day bring together his clan and the Kojin of the Red. How exactly an automaton might do that has yet to be determined...
column4:
I'm a giant tortoise!
A tortoise!
   - Soroban
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 10%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your minitek conveyor minion. The latest in miniature transport technology.
column3: It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so imperial magitek engineers crafted miniature versions of their mountable conveyor unit. However, through some design flaw, the automaton atop the belt appears highly susceptible to possession by voidsent.
column4:
Thankless job, carrier is.
   - Ehcatl Nine Carrier
column6:
Binds all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 8s

column2: Summon your wind-up Fran minion. Stilettos guaranteed not to impede progress through markedly rough terrain such as jungles, bogs, and abandoned monasteries serving as prisons for extra-dimensional forces of evil.
column3: Taking a page from the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, Bangaa fusilier Rinok secretly commissioned the creation of scores of miniature Fran fetishes in an effort to fill the coffers of the perpetually under-funded resistance movement spearheaded by Lente's Tears.
column4:
Fran is not too bad,
once you're on her
good side.
   - Rinok
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Shield by 70%. No effect if Shield is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your wind-up Nu Mou minion. So cuddlesome it hurts.
column3: Designed in the likeness of a former member of Clan Nutsy, this automaton appears so cuddlesome as if it were made of cotton. Most folk think twice about cuddling it, however, when they learn it was actually made by a Nu Mou claybender using mud and mushroom spores.
column4:
A ring, a ring, a wondrous thing,
when its metal band hides
a Nu Mou's sting!♪
    - Nee Marn
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your Seitei minion. Dragon-ness is in the eye of the beholder.
column3: While the true Seiryu has been documented as being more serpent than dragon, this replica of the azure auspice bears a striking resemblance to Kirin (though assurances have been made that this design decision was by no means a cost-cutting measure).
column4:
Hurry up and knock some
sense into Seiryu's noggin!
   - Kamaitachi
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your zephyrous zabuton minion. More pushing for another cushion.
column3: It is well documented that Hingans shun chairs, preferring instead to sit upon the floor. What is less known, however, is that when a speaker utters something deemed clever, she is rewarded with cushions that she may sit in a position elevated above her peers.
column4:
We would be singing of
mending socks and
sitting on cushions.
   - The Wandering Minstrel
column6: Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

column2: Summon your abroader otter minion. Hobbies include playing and having fun on an island in the sun.
column3: Legend tells of a right mad otter who, dissatisfied with the fare of his home waters, bought a ship and made south for more bountiful seas. There, he ate like a king...until his boat sank in a storm, leaving the slippery pup alone on stranger tides.
column4:
He seemed...odd.
Well, odder than usual.
   - Cocobezi
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your hedgehoglet minion. Only your selfless love and affection can keep him blissfully dilemma-free.
column3: For centuries, hedgehogs have been considered a delicacy in the Far East, their succulent flesh supped upon by prince and pauper alike. An influx of Western traders more interested in keeping the pups as pets, however, has all but put an end to this grisly tradition.
column4:
I need not explain what
a needle is, I trust?
   - Redolent Rose
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your brave new Y'shtola minion. Not wont to run from her troubles─and couldn't get very far, anyway.
column3: Lovingly crafted by the Night's Blessed, this tiny mechanical Y'shtola─“Master Matoya,” to some─wears the black garb that marks her a member of their community, and bears a deadwood rod symbolizing her commitment to driving back the Light.
column4:
Did you really think I would
go gently into that dark night
with so much left undone?
   - Y'shtola
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Ryne minion. Not merely a palette swap.
column3: With hair of spun gold and eyes of clearest sapphire, this young maiden was an incarnation of Minfilia, by whose name she was known. In the course of her journey, however, she chose to take her destiny into her own hands, and with it came a new look, name, and automaton likeness.
column4:
What about... Ryne?
   - Thancred
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your black hayate minion. Gaze upon the visage of a ruthless killer.
column3: Despite their endearing appearance, black hayate are oft employed as guard and sheep dogs, as they react to threats with shocking ferocity. It was for this reason that the breed was named after a piece of lethal weaponry from its eastern homeland, now lost to the Flood.
column4:
They expected hounds
on their trail and I sssent
them a dragon!
   - Eshana
column6:
Increases action party ATK by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your chameleon minion and marvel as it melts into your surrounds.
column3: By channeling aether into its crystal-coated scales, the chameleon can alter its appearance to blend into the surrounding environment in a mechanism not unlike that of glamour prisms. For its penchant for adopting new looks, it has earned a reputation as the “glamourous scalekin.”
column4:
Oh, I suggest nothing
so glamorous.
   - Nero tol Scaeva
column6: Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 50%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your wind-up Fuath minion. Markedly less murderous than the real thing.
column3: Though this clockwork automaton─magically rendered waterproof for amphibious adventuring─possess no heart in which to harbor malice, the fact that it was created at the hands of <Emphasis>real</Emphasis> Fuath is cause enough to wonder what tricks it may be hiding up its tiny sleeve.
column4:
The first rule of dealing
with the Fuath...is do <Emphasis>not</Emphasis>
deal with the Fuath.
   - Ardbert
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, reduces the movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your armadillo bowler minion. Possessed of a superior sense of balance.
column3: Armadillos are seldom caught without their rocks, which they use to defend themselves from enemies. As a large rock bespeaks strength and status, one may occasionally see bravado-bound beasts that unwisely choose something beyond their ability to lift.
column4:
Who was that
armored devil!? 
   - Alphinaud
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Great Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee.
column3: This creature, Quinfort insists, is none other than the all-seeing, all-powerful Great Serpent of Ronka. Though its wobbly girth may deceive the eye, that is, presumably, a mere mark of the serpent's mercy, for its true form would be too terrible for mortal minds to comprehend.
column4:
Screee!
   - The Great Serpent of Ronka
column6:
Increases action party movement speed by 30%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your micro gigantender minion. Is it small or is it big? You be the judge.
column3: Though known for their prodigious size, gigantenders come into the world small and grow ever so slowly. This creature is estimated to be between twenty and thirty years of age, which by gigantender standards is still considered young. The oldest known creatures are said to live beyond two centuries.
column4:
In another three hundred years,
I'll be bigger and stronger
than you will ever be!
   - Ohl Deeh
column6: Delivers 8% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your clionid larva minion, small on size but massive on appetite.
column3: A relative of the sea slug, the clionid feeds on plankton early in life. As it matures, however, it begins consuming flesh in order to satisfy its voracious appetite, and uses the tentacles extending from its head to latch onto prey. For now it follows you obediently. For now...
column4:
What a delicious morsel!
I wanna get my tentacles
around her...
   - Ultros
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your bitty duckbill minion. Do not attempt to put on your feet.
column3: Named for its duck-like bill, this creature hunts not by sight or smell, but rather by sensing the aetheric discharge from prey. It can also deliver a potent venom from the spurs on its hindfeet, causing great pain if not death─a sobering contrast to its adorable appearance.
column4:
Aren't you just the most
adorable little thing!?
    - Jessie
column6:
Delivers 20 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your Eden Minor minion. Free of sin, though not for lack of trying.
column3: In a demonstration of its godlike power that may be generously termed “unfathomable,” Eden created this tiny being in its image. Fortunately, the amount of aether Eden Minor can manipulate is so minuscule that, despite its best efforts, it poses little danger to the world at large.
column4:
For what was once
shattered may be
forged anew.
   - Ryne
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 380 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your giant beaver minion, a mystery better left unsolved.
column3: A mysterious being that appeared at Phisor Lran. Whatever may be the truth of its identity, some mysteries in the world are better left unsolved. Let it be enough that everyone has their heart's desire...
column4:
Something tells me
that's one more mystery
better left unsolved.
   - Ellie
column6: Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

column2: Summon your wind-up Suzaku minion, complete with her flute and her senses.
column3: Upon hearing the tale of his compatriot Soroban's adventures, a Kojin dollmaker was moved to honor the Four Lords, guardians of the Ruby Sea. This recreation of Suzaku is one of the fruits of his efforts, masterfully capturing the essence of the legendary auspice.
column4:
If anyone can make Suzaku
see reason, it's you. Good luck!
   - Senri
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 110 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Omega-M minion to observe your irrational behavior.
column3: This automaton is the work of a goldsmith who desired to explore new definitions of beauty. Upon delivering a batch to the House of Splendors, the man is said to have declared, “To understand the one, one must understand the other. For their beauty lies in the whole.”
column4:
<bleep>
hELLo, WOrlD!?
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (40 if the ally is wind-up Omega-F).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Omega-F minion to test the efficacy of combat role allocation.
column3: This automaton is the work of a goldsmith who desired to explore new definitions of beauty. When an engineer of Garlond Ironworks went to question the man about how he came upon his subject matter, he is said to have abruptly vanished, as if swallowed into the Interdimensional Rift.
column4:
Initiating system
shutdown...
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (60 if the ally is wind-up Omega-M).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your tinker's bell minion. Said to be named for a pixie...unless you ask the pixies, who adamantly deny that any of their kind would ever have borne such a ludicrous name.
column3: Discovered fallen off the monstrous Archaeotania by an Ondo youth, this enigmatic instrument, half-bell and half-maiden, is believed to be either an adornment from ancient times or a recreation thereof. Upon it is inscribed an enchantment that amplifies magical power.
column4:
How do you measure
half a bell anyway?
   - Mauto
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your tiny echevore minion. Its tail tastes like nectar...but you wouldn't know such things.
column3: The scales on this critter's back are arranged in such a way as to put one in mind of the succulent echeveria. Lying concealed in tall grass, it lures insects with its tail, which secretes a sweet-tasting fluid akin to nectar.
column4:
I shall enjoy sucking on
its tail for that sweet, sweet
nectar taste!
   - Overzealous Nu Mou
column6:
Grants action party the ability to deal extra damage to Arcana Stones.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your sharksucker-class insubmersible minion. Warning: do not immerse.
column3: Built by a mammet voyager in a moment of boredom, this clockwork ship raises several questions about machine ethics by its very existence. Another, perhaps more significant question it raises is, “Why build a functioning model submersible and not make it watertight?”
column4:
Not water! Anything but water!
   - Zahar'ak Hatchling
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your shoebill minion, an unflappable bird possessed of a regal air...or perhaps simply a condescending one.
column3: Common to Kholusia, the shoebill is known for being literally unmoving. Its hunting effort consists of waiting for prey to wander by its feet before it deigns to strike. For reasons unknown, it saw fit to accept you as its master, and now follows you wherever you go...with the bare minimum of exertion.
column4:
Love can
move shoebills.
   - Ancient Ballad
column6:
Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your butterfly effect minion. Illusory and therefore incapable of invoking any history-shattering consequences...right?
column3: There is a theory which states that the fluttering of a butterfly's wings may give rise to a raging storm a thousand malms away. This crystal has nothing to do with that theory; rather, it is said to simply be the work of a priest of Ronka, created during a bout of boredom.
column4:
Take wing,
ye souls of war!
   - Ravana
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your ironfrog ambler minion, a darling, diminutive, dwarven-made...automaton.
column3: This diminutive automaton is designed to automatically load itself with the ore which serves as its energy source. However, the function appears to be overactive, resulting in it compulsively checking whether the ore is present. The wind-up key is a purely aesthetic addition.
column4:
A-digging we will go!
   - Korutt
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your forgiven hate minion. Having repented its sins, it poses no danger.
column3: A sin eater-esque something or other found on Mt. Gulg. Though it follows you relentlessly, as if driven by hate, it can do little save flutter about and occasionally unravel itself. There seems to be no harm in keeping it with you for now...
column4:
I'm just going to assume
that cube is an eater.
   - Thancred
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your bacon bits minion. Tastes like bacon...if bacon and clay taste the same to you.
column3: After seeing a dream wherein they were being followed by a flying pig, a retainer out gathering absent-mindedly worked some clay into the creature's likeness. To their surprise, the creature suddenly sprang to life─most likely at the hands of a pixie bent on mischief.
column4:
I am curious as to what
mischief the flying pig
has in mind...
   - Sue-Rend
column6: Removes all effects from all enemies and allies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up pixie minion. Won't make mischief at your expense─pixie's honor.
column3: The Dreamspinners present this mammet as a gift to those children whom they have befriended. Unlike a real pixie, it doesn't make mischief, so you don't need to constantly be looking over your shoulders.
column4:
Come and play with us...
   - Titania
column6: Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).

column2: Summon your mystic weapon minion. Only slightly cursed.
column3: While out on a venture, your retainer discovered a timeworn blade and took it in their hand...whereupon a peculiar creature manifested. Though the weapon was believed to be cursed, the retainer was reportedly not concerned, as it was to be given to you in any case.
column4:
I ain't got the patience for
no mystic rubbish today.
   - Gerolt
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your meerkat minion. Keeps an eye out for danger while basking in the sun.
column3: Native to lands bordering the Sea of Ash, these small beastkin dwell in underground colonies, emerging from their burrows as the sun rises in order to bask in the warmth. Curiosity brought this creature to a submersible undergoing repairs on the shore, and it hasn't looked back since.
column4:
I am rather looking forward
 to basking in the sunshine
of her praise.
   - Emmanellain
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your miniature white knight minion. Aids in the purging of sickness. Or not.
column3: Crafted by the Skysteel Manufactory, this mammet was originally conceived for the Temple Knights to use in their strategizing, its mobility allowing for greater realism in battle simulations. Programmed to seek out formidable opponents.
column4:
Only a knight errant may
break a stalemate.
   - Drillemont
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Cute Justice minion. Rocket Punch parts may present a choking hazard. Not for children under the age of two.
column3: Lovingly crafted by an ex-Illuminati scientist now in the employ of the Garlond Ironworks, this colorful toy version of Brute Justice is composed of multiple pieces cast in solid zinc so that it may stand against even the most rambunctious of children.
column4:
Verdict: Guilty.
Punishment: Eradication!
   - Brute Justice
column6:
Changes action party auto-attacks to area of effect attacks.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 12s

column2: Summon your domakin minion. Close, but not a warrior with the body of a mortal and soul of a dragon.
column3: Reeled in by your retainer, this delightfully plump fish was created by a Doman goldfish enthusiast, its name a portmanteau of his nation and the local word for gold. It floats in the air by virtue of the cloudsbreath seeds it devoured, though how it manages to breathe is unknown.
column4:
Quite a catch indeed!
   - Nortmoen
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your dress-up Estinien minion. Sun-dried squid not included.
column3: A mammet fashioned in the likeness of the Azure Dragoon Estinien following his retirement from service. Created for the purpose of educating the younger generation about the Dragonsong War, it has been distributed to places of learning throughout Ishgard.
column4:
I find myself less and less
inclined to sear your squid!
   - Orn Khai
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your little leannan minion. Doesn't see you as food. Yet.
column3: Having just recently sprouted, this leannan young still possesses a mild temperament, but as its demands for nutrients grow, it will begin to hunt men and beasts alike. In preparation for this, it has already begun practicing its skills of enthrallment.
column4:
Seeds know no borders; they
will sprout wheresoever the
earth embraces them.
   - Martineau
column6: Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 60%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your wind-up hobgoblin minion. Crafted in the likeness of your mother...or so certain dwarves would say.
column3: Contrary to what certain dwarves may claim, the hobgoblin upon which this mammet was based is no relation of yours; rather, it was a creature that was haunting your retainer's dreams. By crafting this minion and gifting it to another, they hoped to pass on the nightmare.
column4:
Your mother was
a hobgoblin!
   - Giott
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 270 to all enemies within range.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Cerberpup minion. With three wet little noses and three sets of adorable staring eyes, what's not to love? Aside from all of the teeth, obviously.
column3: This peculiar creature was found in a dark corner of a storehouse belonging to House Haillenarte. As voidsent are not uncommon in the wilds of Coerthas, it was at first thought to be a lesser such monstrosity, but─aside from the three heads─it appears to be an ordinary pup.
column4:
We'll see if our bite's
worse than our bark.
   - Hilda
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your pod 054 minion. The perfect assistant for adventuring...or it would be, if it worked properly.
column3: Dug up in the depths of a factory fallen to ruin, this diminutive white machina was apparently designed to provide tactical support to a YoRHa. Though equipped with myriad functions, from support fire to advance conversation, none of these are operational at present.
column4:
Machines are not to be trusted,
least of all those that can think.
   - Estinien
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your pod 316 minion. The perfect assistant for adventuring...or it would be, if it worked properly.
column3: Dug up in the depths of a factory fallen to ruin, this diminutive black machina was apparently designed to provide tactical support to a YoRHa. While most of its functions are no longer operational, it remains determined to attend the object of its support.
column4:
Machina are mighty and
can smite muchly, yes, but
they need fuel.
   - Softknox
column6:
Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your sungold Talos minion. Guaranteed to make you the envy of collectors and younglings alike.
column3: During its heyday, Daedalus Stoneworks created this miniature Talos, which boasts true-to-life detail and a premium gold overlay. It proved so popular, the story goes that, to meet demand, the company had to recruit master gilders from all over Norvrandt.
column4:
A much smaller Talos from our
company could just as easily
perform the same task!
   - Chai-Nuzz
column6: Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 90%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your Malone minion. If it weren't following you around, it would be tearing hapless adventurers apart on the Diadem.
column3: A young prehistoric creature found on the Diadem, whose unforgiving environment forged its kind into ruthless predators. For reasons unknown, it saw you as friend instead of food, and began following you. Ever ravenous, it snaps at its own tail whenever it comes into view.
column4:
There are too many of them.
Too many dinosaurs for us
to face alone!
   - Vath Braveheart
column6:
Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your little leafman minion. Definitely a leafman. The pixie said so.
column3: This curious being was found amongst the wares peddled by a pixie playing merchant. While it does bear resemblance to the leafmen scattered across Il Mheg, that it is able to move raises eyebrows, but inquiring after the reason only elicits impish laughter from the pixie.
column4:
We're going to get
along like a leafman
on fire, I just know it!
   - Uin Nee
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your Behelmeted Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee in all of its behelmeted glory.
column3: This incarnation of the Great Serpent of Ronka is said to have appeared before the Stewards and directed them to restore the broken Qitari stela. Though equipped with a mining helm, the all-seeing divinity obviously has no need of such mortal contrivances to navigate dark caverns.
column4:
Scree! Scree!
   - The Behelmeted Serpent of Ronka
column6: Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your Behatted Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee in all of its behatted glory.
column3: Seeking to honor the Great Serpent of Ronka, the Stewards recreated the stylish ensemble it was once observed sporting, and made an offering of it to one of the divinity's incarnations gracing the Stopple. All agree that the outfit brings out the stately serpent's adventurous aspect.
column4:
Screee-eee!
   - The Behatted Serpent of Ronka
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your silver dasher minion. Never was there a bird so adorable.
column3: This little bird suddenly appeared inside the hold of a submersible, in all likelihood wandering in when the mammet pilot surfaced the vessel and opened the hatch for fresh air. It has since gone on to charm everyone with its adorable appearance and antics.
column4:
Oh, isn't it adorable?
   - Jihli Aliapoh
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your paissa patissier minion. Currently in training as a culinarian, and looks the part.
column3: This paissa young was found amongst supplies sent from Camp Cloudtop. As punishment for pillaging the victuals, it was put to work in the kitchens, where it surprised everyone by demonstrating an aptitude for the culinary arts. The caramel milk tea it makes is to die for.
column4:
They don't come much
curiouser than the paissa.
   - Noelle
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your paissa threadpuller minion. Currently in training as a weaver, and looks the part.
column3: When mysterious embroidery began appearing on the garments of her Rose Knights, Lady Laniaitte set out to uncover the perpetrator. Her surveillance led to the capture of this paissa young, which was made to work in Ishgard's restoration as punishment, though it appears happy enough.
column4:
Death by ungainly paissa...
thought mortifies Vanu worse
than forgetting sundrop dance!
   - Eenu Vanu
column6: Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

column2: Summon your ancient one minion. Small and appearing to be fractured, but whole.
column3: This lifelike miniature of an ancient was recreated from a small concept crystal discovered in Anamnesis Anyder. Though believed to have been some manner of toy, given the towering stature of the ancients, its size is comparable to that of a Lalafellin child.
column4:
The challenge of deciphering
the wisdom of the ancients
is a researcher's dream.
   - Y'mhitra
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>critters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your Major-General minion. It's a shark. With legs.
column3: “Many heads are so passé. Legs are the wave of the future,” someone did say. Little did they know that there already were sharks that possessed not only legs, but arms besides. How these killing machines came to be, however, is a question left unpondered if you value your sanity.
column4:
To think I almost 'ad
ye fed to the sharks!
   - Rhoswen
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Dulia-Chai minion. Complete with asphyxiated Chai-Nuzz.
column3: On the occasion of their twentieth anniversary, Chai-Nuzz gifted his wife her mammet likeness, which he made using Talos construction techniques. It was subsequently presented to the departing Warrior of Darkness as a memento─with one small addition.
column4:
Dear─ Dearest─
I─ I can't─
   - Chai-Nuzz
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your amaro hatchling minion. It may make a fine steed if you live long enough to see it reach maturity.
column3: This infantile amaro's wings are not yet strong enough to lift it more than an ilm or so off the ground, try as it might. Given enough time around people, it may gain the gift of speech, but with you for a master, that process may be somewhat delayed...
column4:
Oh, how I envy the amaro.
In all of creation, no animal
is so pure, so perfect...
   - Bethric
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Laladile minion. Because small is beautiful.
column3: Unlike its monstrous cousins, this scalekin grows no more than a few fulms long and is docile besides. Once favored as a pet by Ishgardian nobility, who named it for the affable Lalafellin folk, it is known to befriend other creatures such as small birds.
column4:
Never fuss over a sarcosuchus.
   - Traditional Children's Song
column6:
Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your unlucky rabbit minion. Has known the bitterest lows and the sweetest highs.
column3: Born of an idea proposed by Godbert Manderville, this leporine mammet proved tremendously popular in Ul'dah, but questions of ownership rights led to it serving as the mascot of the Platinum Mirage for a spell. It eventually returned to the Gold Saucer after legal matters were settled.
column4:
The damn things reproduce
faster than rabbits in heat.
   - Raganher
column6:
Increases action party movement speed by 30%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Lalinator 5.H0 minion. It doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And it absolutely will not stop, ever, until you have been lali-ho'd.
column3: Wishing to improve his lackluster lali-hoing, Ronitt created this automaton in secret to be his practice partner. Boasting precision movement and powered by dwarven ethanol, it performs rousing lali-hos the equal of any dwarf worth his ale.
column4:
A “lali-ho” gets a
“lali-ho,” you hear?
   - Giott
column6:
Binds all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up Mystel minion. Modeled upon no one in particular. No, really.
column3: Desiring to honor a certain individual with a mammet likeness but knowing that it would go against his wishes to do so, the artisans of the Crystalline Mean came up with the perfect solution: make a mammet likeness anyway but give it a vague name. That makes everything all right...right?
column4:
By any other name,
I would still be a rose!
   - Masked Rose
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your wind-up Ardbert minion. What he lacks in size, he makes up for in heart...and his disproportionately large axe.
column3: This mammet was created to honor Ardbert, the hero who fought to save the First as a Warrior of Light and Darkness both. His spirit lives on in all who has ever thought to lend a helping hand to his fellow man.
column4:
As brightly as a hero's tale shines,
it is not without its shadows.
   - The Wandering Minstrel
column6:
Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your magitek helldiver F1 minion. Minimal firepower, maximum attitude.
column3: Although a single-rider flying machina like the sky armor, the helldiver is an entirely different beast to handle due to its fundamentally distinct design. Thus were such scale models produced, that would-be pilots might study their flight dynamics prior to taking the helm.
column4:
Did that man just bring down
flying armor with a single stroke
<Emphasis>in midair</Emphasis>?
   - Aymeric
column6: Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your weatherproof gaelicat minion. Makes you feel toasty warm simply to behold it.
column3: It is theorized that the gaelicat's garb is no garb at all, but an extension of its corporeal form. That this specimen appears to be wearing a winter coat is the result of its adaptation to Coerthan climes, while its ample girth came about via a more mundane process: overeating.
column4:
There is no creature so
heavenly as the cat!
   - Feline Fanatic
column6:
Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 13%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your ephemeral necromancer minion. If it could, it would summon forth an army of equally adorable undead.
column3: As a token of gratitude for playing with them, a pixie created for you this miniature version of the spectral necromancer, the hero from a distant world whom you fought. Whoever that mysterious maiden may have been, her tale may never be known.
column4:
If you go and die on me, I'll pay a 
necromancer to raise you from the
dead so I can kill you out of spite!
   - Renda-Rae
column6: Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

column2: Summon your Allagan melon minion. Capable of movement and tremendously juicy.
column3: Since ancient times, melons have been favored in many cultures as nature's drinking flask. Not satisfied with merely their thirst-quenching property, however, Allagan scientists set out to make them portable, and this self-propelled melon is the fruit of their labors.
column4:
And you say his muscles swelled
to bursting, like firm melons
ripening in the summer sun!?
   - Company Muscle
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 270 to all enemies within range.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your sand fox minion. Will perform tricks for a lick of birch syrup.
column3: The descendant of a thousand-year-old vulpine spirit, this creature dreamed of training under the tutelage of its legendary forebear, Sotan. Alas, it was turned away, and ended up taking you as its master instead. Though it will devour most anything you give it, it has grown fond of birch syrup.
column4:
You can't smoke out
a fox with hot air.
   - Bran
column6: Disarms deployed enemy traps.

column2: Summon your petit pteranodon minion. It might be cute now, but wait till it grows and becomes a scourge of the skies.
column3: Abandoned by its parents, this pteranodon young was discovered by an Ishgardian botanist during a foray on the Diadem. Though initially aloof, through regular hand-feeding it grew fond of people, and was placed in your care that it might become a worldly sort of prehistoric creature.
column4:
When is a dinosaur
not a dinosaur?
   - Folk Riddle
column6:
Increases action party movement speed by 30%. 
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Dáinsleif F1 minion. Does not form the head. Or any other part of the body, for that matter.
column3: Following the success of the magitek avenger, imperial scientists looked to various other creatures for inspiration in designing their next warmachina, this feline automaton being the test model for their studies into quadrupedal carnivores.
column4:
They're fierce carnivores, who
see steel-clad knights as nothing
more than a packed lunch.
   - Alexondre
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your Lord Enma minion. The last in a line of kings who guided the fate of the Yo-kai World.
column3: The last in a line of kings who guided the fate of the Yo-kai World. Within him dwell both the souls of a courageous young human boy and an all-powerful Yo-kai.
column4: Bring it on!
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your Lord Ananta minion. The new ruler of the Yo-kai World.
column3: The new ruler of the Yo-kai World. Once a rival of the now abdicated King Enma, he became a trusted ally and friend.
column4: Let us be off!
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your Zazel minion. Counselor to generations of Enmas, the Yo-kai kings.
column3: Counselor to generations of Enmas, the Yo-kai kings. He repelled the corruption of the Overseer with the last Enma after he abdicated the throne.
column4: My lord!
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your Damona minion. The daughter of an Oni pirate king.
column3: The daughter of an Oni pirate king. She is learned in the mystic arts but, as a trade-off, lacks emotion.
column4: The time has come.
column6:
Binds all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your 2B automaton minion. For when you need the company of a compact version of an advanced combat android dressed in a distinctive subculture style.
column3: Recovered from deep within the Puppets' Bunker, this diminutive automaton bears a resemblance to the android known as YoRHa No.2 Type B. Why such a thing was created and by whom, however, are questions that will likely remain unanswered.
column4:
So there're androids, which
are machines, but also other
machines, and also...
   - Dig Site Chief
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your 2P automaton minion. For when you need the company of a compact version of an advanced combat android dressed in a distinctive subculture style.
column3: Though this automaton found within the Puppets' Bunker bears a resemblance to the android known as YoRHa No.2 Type P, it thankfully doesn't appear to be hostile. Created through unknown technology, how it operates is a complete mystery.
column4:
Not that I'm not eager to
take apart an android,
but...how do we...do that?
   - Konogg
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon forth your much-coveted Mora minion. Few wavekin have ever been the object of so much anticipation, only to be followed by such crushing disappointment.
column3: The bane of many an ocean fisher, the Momora Mora exhibits all the qualities of much rarer and more desirable catches...until it is hoisted out of the water.
column4:
Fishing's like philanderin'─
ye never know what ye'll catch!
   - Wawalago Momolago
column6: Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

column2: Summon your Syldrion-class insubmersible minion. Unlike the craft on which it is modeled, it will break immediately upon coming into contact with water.
column3: Despite being an incredibly realistic replica of a Syldra-class submersible, it lacks any such aquatic capabilities. It is, however, able to hover in midair for a seemingly limitless amount of time, which is considerably more impressive.
column4:
I'll stick to swimming, thank you very much.
   - Alisaie Leveilleur
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Gaia minion. Those who think the hammer is just for show had best watch their toes.
column3: Supposedly discovered by those investigating the Empty, its appearance there is both inexplicable and implausible. Considering all the other unlikely events that occurred there, however, perhaps the sudden materialization of a hammer-wielding mammet is not so unusual after all.
column4:
Let me get this straight.
You came to talk to me about
<Emphasis>biscuits</Emphasis>?
   - Gaia
column6: Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 60%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

column2: Summon forth your wind-up Palom minion. Try not to break it.
column3: Based on one half of a pair of twin mages, this charming minion brings an air of mischief wherever it goes. The tales say that the real Palom mastered the dark arts by the age of five, though one has to question whether teaching dangerous magic to small children is such a good idea.
column4:
Something stinks.
   - Palom
column6:
Increases DEF of all allies within range by 20.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s
