Harnessing the soul of the fearsome Cath Palug, she possesses razor-sharp claws and looks the part of a feline out to toy with her foe. All spectators can enter the draw for a chance to win one of their very own!
column4:
I hope you're ready to
be ripped to shreds!
   - Black Cat
column6:
Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your brushed-up Krile minion. She is not to be brushed off in the face of danger.
column3: On the occasion of the anniversary of Eorzea's rebirth, the Adventurers' Guild commissioned a new mammet designed in Krile's likeness. With the hood of her pictomancer's attire drawn back to reveal her precious earring, she exudes a spirit of adventure and discovery.
column4:
I'm eager to put my
pictomancy to the proof.
   - Krile
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 30% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your wind-up Zero minion. And thus she is returned.
column3: A mammet inspired by a hero of the Thirteenth, who wandered alone for millennia after her world was consumed by Darkness. Sharing her taste in cuisine, the Hannish artisan responsible poured their heart into its creation and ensured accuracy in every detail, such as the scythe she wields from her days as an avatar.
column4:
I will let it burn,
this fire in my breast.
   - Zero
column6:
Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your wind-up Erenville minion. Happy to follow rather than guide you for a change.
column3: A complementary companion to an illustrated encyclopedia, this automaton was commissioned by the Studium's publications department as part of a recruitment campaign for gleaners. Though designed in the likeness of Erenville, the man himself was not consulted on its creation on account of being afield at the time.
column4:
Don't try to fool an expert.
   - Erenville
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 10.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Nano Lord minion. The land probably won't tremble before his might.
column3: A diminutive manifestation of the Shadow Lord, which arose from the core of his memories in the wake of battle. While the original Shadow Lord was a dreaded existence in the world of Vana'diel, where he led the Beastman Confederate in a war of conquest against the Enlightened Races, this entity thankfully appears to pose no danger.
column4:
Minions of the Shadow Lord!?
   - Iroha
column6:
Increases action party DEF by 40.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Adamant Weapon minion. A diamond by any other name would shine as bright─at least when scale is accounted for.
column3: Retrieved from an imperial base, this scale prototype of a warmachina appears to have been created for counter G-Warrior testing and carries no armaments. After completing their analysis, the Eorzean Alliance saw fit to bestow it upon members as a reward for exemplary service.
column4:
'Twould require a heart as hard as diamond
to raise one's voice in anger to beings
possessed of such profound...saccharinity.
   - Urianger
column6: Delivers 8% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your toco toquito minion. A tropical bird that is all beak and has a squawk to match.
column3: Inhabiting the tropical forests of Tural, the toco toquito is most notable for its prodigious beak, which is deceptively light on account of being hollow. Further identifiable by its blue-ringed eyes and the reddish emblazoning upon its hind, it is also fondly referred to as the jewel of the forest.
column4:
Why, this is it! The very
jewel I spoke of!
   - Sula
column6:
Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your shshuye minion. One day it may become a dread tural vidraal, but it is not this day.
column3: Its name meaning “leaping sun” in the Shetona tongue, this variety of jackrabbit native to Yyasulani is held by the Shetona people to be a distant relative. In the past, a fearsome tural vidraal emerged from this otherwise harmless species and terrorized the people of Yuweyawata.
column4:
Clearly, you are at a complete loss as to
the identity of the virile gentle-rabbit
who stands before you!
   - Godbert
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your spinettesaurus minion. Small though it may be, never let it be said that it has no spine.
column3: The young of a prehistoric reptile, this creature possesses protruding spines that are likened to a sail, which it uses to regulate body temperature and perform courtship displays. In contrast to its stunted forelimbs, it is blessed with powerful legs that allow it to move quickly and snatch up prey in its elongated jaws.
column4:
So long, spiny whatever-you-are.
   - Languid Lominsan
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your wind-up Pelupelu minion. The perfect souvenir, if it does say so itself.
column3: A series of this automaton was crafted by a potsworn goldsmith to serve as a promotional souvenir for the Pelupelu-run Turali Travel Agency. While the use of Kozama'uka lumber lends it a homespun appearance, it moves in a highly life-like manner thanks to the advanced mechanisms within.
column4:
The Pelupelu value the act of
spreading joy through trade.
   - Erenville
column6: Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your tin soldier S3 minion. The toy with a body of tin and a heart of gold.
column3: Boasting remarkably expressive movements despite its old-fashioned design, this tin soldier was brought to Limsa Lominsa on a vessel that plies the trade route west. According to the merchant who acquired it, such pieces were made in the likeness of a soldier of a bygone and faraway kingdom.
column4:
I shall have to examine one of
these mechanical soldiers later.
   - Y'shtola
column6: Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

column2: Summon your Deathservant minion. Literally has a taste for life.
column3: In the course of being used in ritual sacrifices to ward off famine, this ancient stone dagger awakened as a malevolent spirit driven by an insatiable hunger for life force. By journeying with you and absorbing the essence of felled fiends, it is hoped that it will be able to suppress its murderous urges.
column4:
Another sacrificial ritual!
   - X'rhun Tia
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your wisp of Darkness minion. What it cannot smother, it nibbles. What it cannot nibble, it tickles.
column3: In the course of recalling your ferocious battle with the Cloud of Darkness, this curious mammet somehow came to be in your possession. While its design is highly reminiscent of the works of the notorious goldsmith who crafted the wind-up succubus, there is no way to ascertain the truth of its origin.
column4:
I can't begin to imagine how
powerful it must have been.
   - Ryne
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your wind-up Themis minion. A minion as loyal as your star is bright─a minion not bound by the confines of this world, or any other.
column3: Designed in the likeness of Themis, two of these mammets were produced at Professor Claudien's behest, with one being delivered by your own hands to Erichthonios. Cutting-edge Sharlayan techniques were employed in its fabrication, that it might not look amiss in the world of the ancients.
column4:
Were my eyes mistaken?
Was that Themis?
   - Erichthonios
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppets<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your Lawnblazer minion. Railroad not required.
column3: Created by Xak Tural Railing as part of a publicity campaign, this toy locomotive marries a simple and warm design with spirited movement. So well received was the product by staff members, the company is entertaining the possibility of venturing into toy manufacturing in earnest.
column4:
Behold, the pinnacle of
locomotive engineering!
   - Shenza
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your Psamathe minion. An entity born of the fire-wielding familiar Triton. That's the red one.
column3: This peculiar entity appears to have manifested from Triton, the fire-wielding familiar that served among the collective of three that controlled the weather on the Occult Crescent. Though its intelligence has faded over the course of long years, in this diminutive state, it should largely be harmless.
column4:
You would be well advised to ask
yourself: can I stand the heat?
   - Charlys
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your Naiad minion. An entity born of the ice-wielding familiar Nereid. That's the purple one.
column3: This peculiar entity appears to have manifested from Nereid, the ice-wielding familiar that served among the collective of three that controlled the weather on the Occult Crescent. Though its sense of morality has faded over the course of long years, in this diminutive state, it should largely be harmless.
column4:
I have no doubt that it is capable
of chilling victims to the bone!
   - The Impresario
column6: Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

column2: Summon your Deimos minion. An entity born of the poison-wielding familiar Phobos. That's the green one.
column3: This peculiar entity appears to have manifested from Phobos, the poison-wielding familiar that served among the collective of three that controlled the weather on the Occult Crescent. Though its sense of propriety has faded over the course of long years, in this diminutive state, it should largely be harmless.
column4:
Well, of course they'll be poisoned!
How else would I gauge the efficacy
of your work?
   - Severian
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 and knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your boon baboon minion. May sound like a generous creature, but don't expect any favors.
column3: The male of this species of baboon is identifiable by the luxurious growth of fur around its shoulders, which gives the impression of a mantle. In stark contrast, its buttocks are completely bare, with plump, red cheeks on display for all and sundry to see. In certain parts of the Far East, baboons are regarded fondly by avid readers due to their cry resembling the local name of a popular work of fantasy.
column4:
This clearing is currently as bare
as a white baboon's buttocks.
   - Felicitous Furball
column6: Reduces HP of enemy Shield by 70%. No effect if Shield is already inoperable.

column2: Summon your clockwork oppressor. Painted a rugged shade of green, this miniature machina is a scale replica of the full-size model deployed in military training exercises.
column3: An Ironworks machina enthusiast has replicated the Astragalos oppressor in tiny, toylike form. On account of its considerable bulk and heft, however, it failed to find willing merchants for distribution, and was ultimately repurposed as an allied training trophy.
column4:
We shall cast down the oppressors!
   - Chalteaufite
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Ja Tiika leafkin minion. What lies beneath its glowing blue leaves is best left a mystery.
column3: Among the blue leafkin that inhabit Yak T'el, this particular creature is friendly to men, and dwelled near a settlement in the Ja Tiika Heartland. While superstition persists that that their kind are Mamool Ja who have been cursed, some believe that they are in fact pure souls who were reborn as guardians of the forest.
column4:
Have you heard of blue leafkin?
   - Prudent Hunter
column6:
Inflicts a weakness to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on all enemies within range.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 15s

column2: Summon your Gulool Ja Ja minion. It watches your progress with great interest.
column3: Designed in the likeness of Gulool Ja Ja, this mammet was created to commemorate the seventieth anniversary of his ascension as Dawnservant. It would seem that those Mamool Ja who journeyed to Eorzea brought these units with them with the intent of impressing upon the locals the glory of their kind.
column4:
Gulool Ja Ja, mightiest
of the blessed...arise!
   - Zereel Ja
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>poppet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>).
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your micro rover minion. Won't be moving mountains, but can handle pebbles with aplomb.
column3: This miniaturized model of a utility vehicle used in the Cosmic Exploration Initiative was produced for the amusement of young children. While it faithfully incorporates all the functions of the original machine and can perform various tasks, it lacks the power to move anything beyond pebbles.
column4:
Looking for a ride on
the burrow's best rover?
   - Drivingway
column6: Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

column2: Summon your tipping tortoise minion. Would be a generous tipper if its coins were real.
column3: This tortoise possessed of a gleaming golden shell appears to be the offspring of the trade tortoise, the creature that sought to peddle cursed artifacts on the Occult Crescent. On account of its tender age, however, it is not yet permitted to handle legal tender, and must make do with imitation coins.
column4:
I'd almost forgotten what it was like to
feel the weight of coins in my pocket...
   - Eismon
column6:
Reduces movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your royal hound minion. As loyal as it is royal.
column3: This bright-eyed canine is believed to be descended from hounds that were once bred by the royal family of Alexandria for hunting foxes and deer. Fiercely loyal by nature, it had long sought a worthy master to serve, and appears to have found one in you.
column4:
You've got the nose of a bloodhound.
   - Midnight Dew
column6:
Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>monsters<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your Skallic uolosapa minion. A winsome bird with pure white feathers and a pink beak.
column3: In ages past, the uolosapa was brought from the south sea isles to the nation of Skalla, where it quickly gained popularity as a pet. In the course of being bred in captivity, a specimen emerged that possessed pure white feathers, the descendants of which have been treated as a variety unto themselves to this day.
column4:
I seem to have made
a feathered friend.
   - Fufucha
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your raven-red gobtank. Faster than the blue one.
column3: An Ironworks machina enthusiast has replicated the Ravens-colored Astragalos gobtank in tiny, toylike form. Though originally meant to be marketed with the permission of the goblins, negotiations broke down over the profit margin, and it was ultimately repurposed as an allied training trophy.
column4:
Pshhh... Gobbies whack
for Ravens muchly!
   - Goblin Mercenary
column6: Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

column2: Summon your falcon-blue gobtank. Stronger than the red one.
column3: An Ironworks machina enthusiast has replicated the Falcons-colored Astragalos gobtank in tiny, toylike form. Though originally meant to be marketed with the permission of the goblins, negotiations broke down over the profit margin, and it was ultimately repurposed as an allied training trophy.
column4:
Pshhh... Gobbies whack
 for Falcons muchly!
   - Goblin Mercenary
column6: Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your wind-up Eald'narche minion. After ten long millennia, the dreams of the Zilart will become reality!
column3: A diminutive manifestation of Eald'narche, which arose from the core of his memories in the wake of battle. While the original Eald'narche was a cunning mastermind who threatened the world of Vana'diel with his brother, Archduke Kam'lanaut, this entity thankfully appears to pose no danger.
column4:
Have you the strength to
find the answers you seek?
   - Eald'narche
column6:
Sets a trap that, when triggered, reduces the movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s 
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Activation Delay:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 10s

column2: Summon your rroneek calf minion. Has tusks and horns and isn't afraid to use them.
column3: The young of a hulking herbivore native to the continent of Tural. The patterns upon the faces of juveniles are pale and uneven, but gain in boldness and definition as they age. Even if they are still small, the creatures leave their parents' side when both their tusks and horns have sufficiently developed, as is the case with this calf.
column4:
Look at you all, shaking
like rroneek calves!
   - Nitowikwe
column6:
Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25.
 <UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 6s

column2: Summon your micro crow minion. Clever and loyal─what more could one ask for?
column3: This crow found at a laboratory within the Meso Terminal was formerly an experimental subject. After researchers vanished from the facility, it managed to survive thanks to its cage's emergency power supply and automatic feeding system. Possessed of great intelligence and a strong sense of duty, it has decided to follow its liberator.
column4:
This would solve all our
problems in one fell swoop!
   - Benathaire
column6: Knocks back all enemies within range.

column2: Summon your sunray ray minion. Its eyes are up here.
column3: A variety of stingray native to Yok Tural, so named for the way it is believed to pierce the clouds like a ray of sunlight. On account of its majestic movement and its underside having the appearance of a friendly face, it has come to be worshipped as a guardian deity by the peoples who dwell by the waters of Zorgor.
column4:
This may sting a little.
   - Honey B. Lovely
column6:
Reduces movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 5s

column2: Summon your mini yan minion. A sheep spirit whose child-pleasing form and diminutive size belie its might.
column3: According to legends in the Ninth, this peculiar creature is a sheep spirit that, despite its adorable form, strikes fear into the hearts of all who encounter it. Though this particular entity appears to have taken a liking to you, you would do well to remember that it is possessed of unknowable power.
column4:
Yer sheep's got magical powers?
   - Traveling Merchant
column6:
Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates.
<UIForeground>F201F8</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F9</UIGlow>Duration:<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> 20s

column2: Summon your gimme kitten minion. An ill-mannered winged feline fiend that wants everything.
column3: This mischief-loving fiend said to mimic spirits in the Ninth is known to have a liking for precious stones, which it will brazenly demand from those it encounters. Though its mood will turn foul if refused, neither will satisfying its desire win you its gratitude, so there is little to be gained from knowing it...but here we are.
column4:
Gimme an elixir!
No, that's not right...
   - Magic Pot
column6: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.
